        <item>
          <title>For Adam...</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;I already posted these to the &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.flickr.com/groups/1440875@N23/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;flickr group&lt;/a&gt;, but here they are again. For those of you that didn&amp;#8217;t know him, Adam was a really amazing guy. Nice, dependable, humble, an all around good guy, even after all he&amp;#8217;d been through. He&amp;#8217;s already missed. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Elder Hellkat.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photomattmills.com/images/adam/0001.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photomattmills.com/images/adam/0002.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

There&amp;#8217;s a memorial bike ride for him starting at Sauced, 1pm on Friday; the car procession will follow the bikes, so anybody in cars who wants to join should be there. Memorial Services are at 2pm at Frontline church, 6th and broadway. The reception is afterwards at the prohibition room, in the gold dome, 23rd and western.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 26 May 2010 03:36:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/05/26/for-adam/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/05/26/for-adam/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>out...</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;of photos to post, after these. Well, there are more, but they&amp;#8217;re not edited.
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Ha. There are so many things that word could mean as a teaser! I could do a poll, what did you think matt mills meant when he said &amp;#8216;out&amp;#8217;? Out of town? Out of his mind? How do you feel about me talking about myself in the third person?
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photomattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0041.jpg&quot; /&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photomattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0042.jpg&quot; /&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photomattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0043.jpg&quot; /&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>a dream and some photos</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;So, last night I had this dream that I got to egypt and somehow had forgotten my cameras, all of them, and all I could get was a film camera, and the only film I could find was ISO 100 color film, and 120-size black and white. Thought you&amp;#8217;d like to know that. 
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Also of note: If you&amp;#8217;re staying at my house and happen to see me before I shower and wake up for a couple hours, I&amp;#8217;m not really human yet. Cro-magnon or something till about noon.

        <item>
          <title>advice from @busblog</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;from the world famous &lt;a href=&quot;http://blog.tonypierce.com/2010/05/somebody-turns-24-tomorrow-bob-d-tp3.html&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;busblog&lt;/a&gt;, tony answers questions sometimes:&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
Kurtis: How do you get over someone?&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

the only way is to get sloppy with several others. keyword: get. all this moping around, writing poems, feeling the depths of depression, etc - all thats played out. its the road most traveled. its for losers. its for the madding crowd. its for people who revolve their schedules around nickleback. first thing you should do this weekend is get a date, make some moves, and think about las vegas. yes you&amp;#8217;ll feel horrible. but you were gonna feel horrible anyways. at least now when you wake up their will be stale champagne on the nightstand. and if youre lucky, it wont be all that stale.&lt;br/&gt;
+ + +
&lt;/blockquote&gt;
so true. and the champagne the next day is never stale if they&amp;#8217;re making mimosas with it. And since I have several exes who read this, all of &amp;#8216;em but you, babe.</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 04 May 2010 09:03:53 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/05/04/advice-from-busblog/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/05/04/advice-from-busblog/</link>
        </item>

        <item>
          <title>NMF in Many Parts (sunday brunch)</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;So, Amber was kind enough to let me and Chas and her bro crash at her house, even leaving the front door open so we didn&amp;#8217;t have to leave the party when she did. The next morning, Amber and josh and I had brunch at the Norman Airport. It&amp;#8217;s a place to go to based on novelty, because the service sucked and the food wasn&amp;#8217;t even as good as ihop.

        <item>
          <title>NMF in Many Parts(2)</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;The number of things going on in this picture is at least double what you think it is. And then there&amp;#8217;s all the things that happened that night that aren&amp;#8217;t in the picture. A couple good rock bands, a hillbilly jug of sangria, a foamy (but free) keg, etc. etc. If I sat here and actually listed everything, you&amp;#8217;d get bored and never read again. You had to be there. And you should have. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0013.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>NMF in Many Parts(1)</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;Because I have this thing about making the page not get too slow to load, and because I feel like people look the individual images better when there aren&amp;#8217;t 21232283 pictures to look at, the NMF stuff will be broken up a bit. This is the first night, second or third show. 
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
I feel like if I were really to describe my life, I&amp;#8217;d be another &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.number27.org/today.php&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;johnathan harris&lt;/a&gt;, it&amp;#8217;s so weird and wonderful and straight up surreal. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;Anyway, evidence:

        <item>
          <title>Clouds</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;I&amp;#8217;ve been doing this thing now for the past couple weeks, when I see a cloud that I like, for whatever reason, I take a picture. Clouds are the ultimate transients. Impossible to pin down. The way the light plays on them is so &lt;i&gt;dramatic&lt;/i&gt;, as if they have moods. 
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Anyway, I&amp;#8217;m thinking of using these for a show I have coming up. I know, I&amp;#8217;m becoming that pretentious asshole I never wanted to become. Whatever, I&amp;#8217;ll probably come up with something better like 48 hours before the show and rush around getting it done in the nick of time. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0009.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0010.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0011.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0012.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Sun, 02 May 2010 11:59:47 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/05/02/clouds/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/05/02/clouds/</link>

        <item>
          <title>NMF Pre-Gaming With Sherree Chamberlain</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;And by pre-gaming, I mean I went to a show, to warm me up for all the other shows. I could have used a drink, as this was a TV taping and all those cameras made me kinda nervous, but after a couple takes I got used to them and was able just to enjoy the music. 
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Why I was there exactly is a little complicated- a friend is a PA or something for the show, and I ran into her when I was in Stillwater a couple months ago at a show, and she asked me to do some stills for them, so I did. And I guess as a thank-you and because they needed warm bodies in the seats, I got to go to the on set taping of the show, Warehouse something or other. 
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Before the show, waiting on the rehearsals to get done. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0006.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The 500mm does its thing. 1/50th of a second baby! &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0007.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Still 1/50th. Little blurry this time, but I still like it. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0008.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Sharp? what? Yeah. I&amp;#8217;m kinda in love with what that lens can do. It&amp;#8217;s hard to focus and hard to use, but the stuff it does is unique.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/coupleweeks/0009.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>sunset walk</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;Today is a weird ass day&amp;#8230; I keep doing that thing you&amp;#8217;re supposed to do in lucid dreams where you look at everything twice, to tell if I&amp;#8217;m awake or not. Man, people in the hospital, (everyone is fine now as far as I know) sudden revelations, breakfast tacos, madness.  
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Yesterday, I lost my voice. I said to Reaghan: &amp;#8220;I took a shot of Tom Waits,&amp;#8221; because when I could talk, that&amp;#8217;s who I sounded like. This morning, eating my taco, I heard in my head his reading of Bukowski&amp;#8217;s poem &amp;#8220;Nirvana&amp;#8221;: &amp;#8220;Not much chance. Completely cut loose from purpose&amp;#8230;&amp;#8221; Oh the &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.theonion.com/articles/i-have-an-ipodin-my-mind,10912/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;ipod of the mind&lt;/a&gt;. 
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Anyway, here are some entirely unrelated photos: 
&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0004.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0005.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 27 Apr 2010 18:59:41 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/04/27/sunset-walk/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/04/27/sunset-walk/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Scissortail Space</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;I&amp;#8217;ve been volunteering at the &lt;a href=&quot;http://scissortailokc.wordpress.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Scissortail social space&lt;/a&gt; the last couple weeks, helping out with their bike shop- it&amp;#8217;s all pay as you can/free. If you&amp;#8217;re having bike problems, come by wednesday after 2, and I&amp;#8217;ll be glad to help. I mean, look at that truing stand. 

&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0003.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

They also have a decent-sized lending library, lots of good books that I have a feeling are hard to find in the MLS libraries. So come hang out, have some coffee (if we have any) and fix yo&amp;#8217; bike. It&amp;#8217;s just south of the corner of 30th and walker, &lt;a href=&quot;http://maps.google.com/maps?client=safari&amp;amp;q=3012+N.+Walker+Oklahoma+City,+OK&amp;amp;oe=UTF-8&amp;amp;ie=UTF8&amp;amp;hq=&amp;amp;hnear=3012+N+Walker+Ave,+Oklahoma+City,+Oklahoma,+73103&amp;amp;gl=us&amp;amp;ei=o0jTS8r1OcT_lgel_rjsDA&amp;amp;ved=0CAcQ8gEwAA&amp;amp;ll=35.500107,-97.521622&amp;amp;spn=0.008044,0.012767&amp;amp;z=17&amp;amp;layer=c&amp;amp;cbll=35.500164,-97.521014&amp;amp;panoid=HTWxLowF16IFz1QCax8YGA&amp;amp;cbp=12,102.31,,0,-5.13&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;right here&lt;/a&gt;, next to the AA Food Mart.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Sat, 24 Apr 2010 20:49:01 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/04/24/scissortail-space/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/04/24/scissortail-space/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>The benefits of coworking...</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;I&amp;#8217;ve been working from the &lt;a href=&quot;http://okccoco.com&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;OKC CoCo&lt;/a&gt; for the last month or so now, and it&amp;#8217;s a really great environment. I mean, not to sound like an advertisement. The concept of it is solid, though. Mostly, it&amp;#8217;s getting work done, but there are all these really smart people around, also working, to bounce ideas off of and build relationships with. Most places I go it&amp;#8217;s very hard to talk about my day job, the things I have to bitch about don&amp;#8217;t even make sense to people who haven&amp;#8217;t struggled with what turns out to be a missing } 300 lines up for hours. Anyway, yeah: 

&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0001.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newcamera/0002.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

Full disclosure: I get my membership in exchange for shooting events for the CoCo.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 23 Apr 2010 23:38:56 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/04/23/the-benefits-of-coworking/</guid>

        <item>
          <title>Walking in the snow</title>
          <description>&lt;p&gt;This was last sunday, and things were just at that stage of melting that we could play with really large chunks of ice. And now I&amp;#8217;m out of backlog to work with, so I have to get more photos off the camera.         <item>
          <title>Last post on blogger</title>
          <description>Well, this is the 371st post, and probably the last here on blogger. It's been a good run; with this and other blogs, I've been using blogger for going on five years (ha ha), but now they're stopping ftp uploading, and while I understand that, it's something I need, or at least that I really want. for the time being, I'll be posting at &lt;a href=&quot;http://photomattmills.tumblr.com&quot;&gt;photomattmills.tumblr.com&lt;/a&gt;, and in the long term I'll be trying to extract the posts from this blog and put up something here that is more or less a redesigned and better Five Years. We'll see.</description>

        <item>
          <title>ICEPOCALYPSE</title>
          <description>Yes, I'm annoyed by my own title.. but I do it because I know so many of you will also be frowning, and that makes me laugh. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So I went for a walk, down to Grant's house to make coffee, and he had some interesting news which I'm not sure I can share yet, not the big Ruby news, but something else really cool for him personally. All I can say is damn. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Just another wanderer. &quot;I'll be all right, as long as I have some traction,&quot; he told me.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/icestorm/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was rush hour, on 23rd street... never seen it this dead at that hour. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/icestorm/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And yeah, there was all this white stuff on the ground. god's cocaine party. Mostly sleet, though, not the fine white powder all kids and skiers love. Blowing wind, sleet in my face, and there I was, taking pictures. It's a 15 minute walk that took me about 20 due to detours.  &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/icestorm/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I do love these lights.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/icestorm/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Good coffee at Grant's, Then I walked to dinner at Mcnellie's.  I kept drinking after dinner, getting drunk and thinking about hard math problems in my head. I always know I've had a long day at the computer when I'm thinking about math, drunk. (was it three or four pints? I was only there an hour and a half, must have been three). Yeah, Snow and Ice and everything nice. I'm going back to bed. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/icestorm/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 29 Jan 2010 14:29:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/01/29/icepocalypse/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/01/29/icepocalypse/</link>
        </item>

        <item>
          <title>I love Winogrand</title>
          <description>From &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.americansuburbx.com/2008/01/theory-interview-with-garry-winogrand.html&quot;&gt;American Suburb X&lt;/a&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;blockquote&gt;Interviewer: If you don't like &quot;street photographer,&quot; how do you respond to that other ÃƒÂ¦tiresome phrase', &quot;snapshot aesthetic&quot;?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Winogrand: I knew that was coming. That's another stupidity. The people who use the term don't even know the meaning. They use it to refer to photographs they believe are loosely organized, or casually made, whatever you want to call it. Whatever terms you like. The fact is, when they're talking about snapshots they're talking about the family album picture, which is one of the most precisely made photographs. Everybody's fifteen feet away and smiling. The sun is over the viewer's shoulder. That's when the picture is taken, always. It's one of the most carefully made photographs that ever happened. People are just dumb. They misunderstand.&lt;/blockquote&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;You should read the whole thing.</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 25 Jan 2010 20:16:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/01/25/i-love-winogrand/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2010/01/25/i-love-winogrand/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>One Long Saturday</title>
          <description>Last saturday was a very long, very good day... it had phases, I did things. I walked the dog with Damaris, then hung out with her and Grant and some other kids for sdinner and drunken fry, and then down to makers and bricktown for fog and fun. Makers is where god would hang out, if he was looking for a jazz club in this town. And the Fog... yeah, it gets a capitol letter. Good stuff. The fog outside lifted the fog inside, if you will. And if you won't, well, too bad. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0013.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0014.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0015.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rebounding/0016.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Since I can't sleep</title>
          <description>I'm gonna post some photos. Two wednesdays ago, I found myself at hooters. No, really. Talk about the ass-end of the restaurant business... I'm told the girls that wait there at least make a lot of money. Good for them, now they just need to work on the food. (These girls, for those of you that don't know them, aren't hooters girls, just friends). Then I went to the new Blue Note. It was weird times 20. Times 10^100. Maybe not that weird; there were no green monsters or invading Persians. Not even any mild-mannered persians. But weird. And cleaner.         <item>
          <title>More from early January</title>
          <description>Because if I don't just do one big post with these, I'll never get them all out, and that would be a tragedy. These are somewhat random; I find myself going out a lot at night. It's the insomnia more than anything; since I'm going to be up anyway, I figure I might as well not be sitting at home bored to death. And I know I've been saying that I want to get away from the 'photos of drunk friends' (or drunken photos of friends) thing, but here they are again anyway. I drink, I take pictures, it's bound to happen. The last photo Kat took, by the way. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0015.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0016.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0017.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0018.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0019.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0020.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Starting off right</title>
          <description>So, this is how we brought in the new year, with chicken pot pie and soup and baked goods. I was so full after that lunch, I didn't eat until lunch the next day. Yes, these are cutesy family photos. I DO WHAT I WANT.         <item>
          <title>Back in Blog</title>
          <description>Yeah, i had another one of those lulls. Always happens. NYE and the surrounding weeks found me unable to drink without getting massive hangovers and as usual, some depression, which wasn't helped by my inability to shoot photos, so the whole thing kind of spiraled downwards so much so that I don't want to be the man with the camera anymore. This is what I feared the most when I took the programming job; by filling my head with something else, there isn't room for the photography. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Look at this hipster.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Of course, we all know that's bullshit. I'm as much a photographer as I was then, and this is just a temporary setback. I'm gonna get my chops back, by hook or by crook, and all will be well with the world. And for the record, I have taken a few good photos, just not as many as I'd like. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Before the freakin' blizzard, or maybe after. Shit conditions to be out in, though.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/newyearsplus/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>the last december birthday</title>
          <description>Mike J's. At the Sipango. And you might think, from these pictures, that it's not a bad place to hang out. You'd be wrong. I wouldn't go there again unless it's someone's birthday, and they won't see reason and come to a bar with less dudebros. The things we do for our friends. Actually, I only stayed for half an hour, everybody was already pretty well wasted by the time I got there. Although I did have dinner and some beers earlier at Mcnellies that night, I wasn't &lt;span &gt;drinking&lt;/span&gt;, if you know what I mean. Tuesday, you know? &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/christmas09/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/christmas09/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/christmas09/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>It's been seven days since...</title>
          <description>I took all these photos. Ok, in that last post, where I said I hadn't taken any good ones of Ali when we were celebrating her bday? I lied. There's one here that I really like and another that's all right, but it's not her face. What else? That was a dfry night, which is becoming more and more common now that blue note has changed the jukebox. My favorite bar is changing owners very soon... this has happened once before, and that change brought us ladies night and free pool afternoons, but we lost good show coming out of there, so maybe this time we'll keep the free beer and get back some awesome shows. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then there are the two pictures in here that aren't portraits. I'm becoming more impulsive with my photography, and that off ramp was an extreme example. I glanced out of the bar door, saw something, and had a compulsion to go out and shoot it. That's all I came up with; although there are several frames, I only like that one. What else? Holly, you'd better be treating my hat well. Regular walks, exercise, hand wash only.           <title>two fridays ago...</title>
          <description>This was the night of Ali's birthday... sorry ali, didn't get any of you, as you were in tulsa... the following night I also didn't get any, because the light in the dfry is shit. I've just had an idea for a new project, though, one that's been staring me in the face for months and me not even noticing. The working title is 'hackers in the heartland'... a hacker in the sense of 'maker' or 'expert'. You know who you are, expect emails soon. And win.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0013.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The two group photos we took: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0014.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0015.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;And my own version of a group photo.         <item>
          <title>I think this was that one night...</title>
          <description>Remember? The night that I drank far far too much? Excessive amounts of excess. So hungover in the morning I couldn't move? Yeah, well, there was this artshow, and I was broke, and a lot of other people fed me booze, but I wasn't really keeping track. I started counting in the morning, and the number of drinks I had was some where in excess of &lt;span &gt;way too many&lt;/span&gt;. I think my short term memory shorted out there at the end, I have a lot of the same picture, like I took it and then forgot. Not that I remember now, but the photos at least tell something. Artifacts. Thank god for autofocus. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I know, deadpan images are dead, but I liked the asshole tax.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Husband...&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;and wife.&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>five minutes for a blog post...</title>
          <description>first one will be brief. This is from two wednesdays ago, for once I wasn't out at blue note, and Chelsea came down to get a cell phone (I have spares and hers was spastic). While I was looking for the charger, she says, &quot;Why don't we go to norman and see my friends play a jazz set?&quot; and of course I went. I always have some fantastic luck when I hang out with her; I met a former South African paratrooper at one party, or there was the time we came across fire-dancers just before a rock show, etc, etc. This time, one of the professors from OU showed up and asked to sit in, and dude was cool. Didn't hog the stage, played a couple good numbers, and left. And my five minutes were up a while ago: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Trumpet playin' man.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/oneweekindec/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;More later.</description>

        <item>
          <title>Pearl Goes Away</title>
          <description>It seems like every weekend, we have and excuse to party... and if there is no party, we at least have a reason to drink. Anyway, I know these are like a week and a half late, but I really had far too much fun at this party and the day after... I've had a lot of good days in the past moth or so, and this was one of them (or at least that night and the next morning). The kind of good time that makes me want to hang onto certain pictures, even though they're not as good. When I rush to post, that's when you see 40 pictures split into two posts; when I wait, you get 7 pictures in one post, but I think they're the best 7. Anyway, on with the show: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pearlgoesaway/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pearlgoesaway/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pearlgoesaway/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pearlgoesaway/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pearlgoesaway/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pearlgoesaway/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pearlgoesaway/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Return to the Fry</title>
          <description>So, a couple weeks ago now, I was in the Drunken fry and some dudebro tried to steal my hat and then start a fight with Cody. This was a mistake on his part, and, well, nothing happened, not really. But I'd been avoiding the fry after that, because who wants to deal with that shit? Anyway, last friday a bunch of us started the night getting smashed and playing dominoes, at which point going to the fry sounded like a good idea. And then there weren't enough seats in the car, so I said &quot;Fuck it, I'll ride my bike.&quot; And it was awesome and cold, but mostly awesome. And then drunken, and then fries, in phases. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/returnfry/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>friendsgiving part 2</title>
          <description>Some good discussion over on my facebook with Kris Kanaly re: that last post where I said the oughts sucked in a lot of ways. If you can read it you should, I don't feel like re-hashing a lot of stuff here. A note on the nature of this blog: I post the photos for other people to see, and I write stuff for myself. It's always rough and nothing I say here is ever final or complete. Also: I didn't mean that there was nothing good happening anywhere, just that only a few pieces of art (and by art I mean writing, painting , photography, and any creative endeavour) were what I'd call transformative, that stick with you, that change you, that have a lasting effect. Then I realized, on reflection, that a small number of works like that might be normal. Not that the worlds sucks, but you don't make the mona lisa every day, either. A fault, but I think the rest of the argument stands- reducing noise and increasing good signal is a good thing. Anyway, on with the photos. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Apples to apples, which is an excellent idea while drunk, even though I lost a lot.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Fixing the flag. also: Permanent Distress would be a good name for a punk band.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0013.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0014.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0015.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Hot ass. Wait. I mean, on fire. Well, jumping over it, anyway.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0016.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0017.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;INFINITE BROMANCE:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0018.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0019.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0020.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Friendsgiving part 1</title>
          <description>This post is brought to you by the agave-turkey-waffle-taco, and box wine. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/friendsgiving/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 08 Dec 2009 23:05:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/08/friendsgiving-part-1/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/08/friendsgiving-part-1/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>some thoughts and some random</title>
          <description>I've been thinking, a lot of people are saying what a craptastic decade this has been, calling it the 'naughts' because that's what it ammounts to. The whole world and every single one of us in it has had kind of a shitty time. There are a few gleaming shiny bits of technology and a lot of death and hate and crap and that's about it. Music has gone to hell. I haven't seen any art that really floored me since about 2003, and all of that was made before 2000. What the hell, people? &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I think I have one answer- it's not all of the answer, because so much shit comes from a lot of assholes- but for the first time ever, we have access to everything we want, ever. You know that impulse you have to look at every title in the bookstore at least once, so you don't miss anything? Or to go through all the rooms in the thrift store, for that one special find? That same impulse combined with the internet and the exponential growth of things available to look at has completely consumed our collective conscious. It's normal to be obsessed with something, and it's weird to be disconnected. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Here's the catch: &lt;span &gt;obsessives are crazy&lt;/span&gt;. Not the good crazy, the stay up for three weeks on benzedrine and write the great american novel crazy, but the found dead in her house with two dead cats under piles of used toilet paper rolls crazy. We have been so obsessed with mining all that is out there and finding the gems that we have made no time to create our own identity. You think to yourself if you can just finish this season of lost or get that Eames chair or write the perfect tweet, then you can be at peace, but that's a lie.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The truth is, there is no such thing as being finished. There is no rest until you're dead, and no safety either. And as long as you spend your time keeping up with the latest and greatest of the whole world and all of your friends, you will have no time for yourself, to make the world a better place. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'm not saying to cut yourself off from twitter and facebook and all of that. They are wonderful tools for communication, and they should be used that way. You are not a one person broadcast to the world; you're leaving a note for your friends. You can't keep up with everything, so you might as well take the time to do something that's worth sharing. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And yes, I realize the inherent contradiction, putting this on my blog. Where the hell else am I going to put it? Why share something like this in a channel nobody cares about any more, like a dumb old magazine or newspaper. This is the fucking future, and we didn't get our flying cars and vacations around venus and all that shit, but we did get blogs and iphones and all the tools we could ever dream of for making the world however we want it. Let's let go of the old shit and get out there and create something of our own. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Enough rant. I hope you read it and didn't skip to the photos, even though I like these photos. I have more in this vein, including an expansion of what I mean about not being a broadcast for the whole world, but that's another rant, and there are plenty of photos to bait you all with later, no? ;)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Adam lock Was back in ton for like two seconds, and these are two from that night at Mcnellies. Have fun kids, and look for freindsgiving photos tomorrow. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/onlock/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/onlock/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 08 Dec 2009 01:38:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/08/some-thoughts-and-some-random/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/08/some-thoughts-and-some-random/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>pretty freakin' awesome</title>
          <description>via &lt;a href=&quot;http://succeedblog.org&quot;&gt;succeedblog&lt;/a&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;object width=&quot;400&quot; height=&quot;225&quot;&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;allowfullscreen&quot; value=&quot;true&quot; /&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;allowscriptaccess&quot; value=&quot;always&quot; /&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;movie&quot; value=&quot;http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=4197108&amp;amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;amp;show_title=1&amp;amp;show_byline=1&amp;amp;show_portrait=0&amp;amp;color=&amp;amp;fullscreen=1&quot; /&gt;&lt;embed src=&quot;http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=4197108&amp;amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;amp;show_title=1&amp;amp;show_byline=1&amp;amp;show_portrait=0&amp;amp;color=&amp;amp;fullscreen=1&quot; type=&quot;application/x-shockwave-flash&quot; allowfullscreen=&quot;true&quot; allowscriptaccess=&quot;always&quot; width=&quot;400&quot; height=&quot;225&quot;&gt;&lt;/embed&gt;&lt;/object&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://vimeo.com/4197108&quot;&gt;Pop Up&lt;/a&gt; from &lt;a href=&quot;http://vimeo.com/user1474033&quot;&gt;abw&lt;/a&gt; on &lt;a href=&quot;http://vimeo.com&quot;&gt;Vimeo&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 04 Dec 2009 17:27:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/04/pretty-freakin-awesome/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/04/pretty-freakin-awesome/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>

        <item>
          <title>Calories</title>
          <description>I just found out that 20% of the calories you burn are burned by your brain. Does that mean, then, that people with super high metabolism can think more and/or faster? Endurance athletes: ultramarathon runners, touring cyclists who do 80+ miles a day, anybody at the olympics, people like that. Can prolonged exercise make you smarter just by making the processor run hotter?</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 01 Dec 2009 17:19:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/01/calories/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/12/01/calories/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>people come back to town for a holiday</title>
          <description>Somebody this weekend asked me this weekend, in a pointed, trying-to-give-advice kind of way, why I hang out with the people I do... as if there are better people somewhere. The truth is it's damn hard to find people I can talk to, I need all the friends I can get. Real people, people who don't fuck with trivialities. They sure as hell have their faults, but so do I. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Speaking of friends, of real people... a bunch of people came back into town last week for the holiday, all of whom I was glad to see. This is mostly about them, and the next few posts, too... it's been a good break. Now back to the grind. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Rayguns and Devin.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/txgiving/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/txgiving/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Caitlin, in from Austin fo a day, then gone the next.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/txgiving/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I flew a kite that day, and it was fun even though the wind was weak sauce.         <item>
          <title>had a thought walking to 7-11</title>
          <description>so, I was thinking about twitter... and social media in general... a mistake most so-called experts make is thinking of little updates as &lt;span &gt;broadcasting&lt;/span&gt;, when really it's &lt;span &gt;backchannel&lt;/span&gt;. You have a hundred twitter followers that also follow you, you're inside that circle of people, messaging them things that are irrelevant or unimportant to the rest of the world, but that they might find useful/entertaining/funny. Non-sequiturs. The useful information that you get from the chatter are the things you wouldn't have found otherwise. Most importantly, it's &lt;span &gt;behind the scenes&lt;/span&gt;. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That's true for most twitter users, I'd bet. Then there are the &quot;experts&quot; who think of twitter as a place to sell stuff; it's a free way to shout things about your product, after all. The problem is, when seen in the light of the above: all advertising on twitter is effectively noise. If your product is good, it will get word of mouth (actually, you'll get more word of mouth if it's bad or easy to make fun of; see snuggies, slap-chop, etc.). </description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 25 Nov 2009 19:50:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/11/25/had-a-thought-walking-to-7-11/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/11/25/had-a-thought-walking-to-7-11/</link>
        </item>

          <title>yeah, yeah, I know...</title>

        <item>
          <title>what's next?</title>
          <description>this is always on my mind. For a very long time, I've been casting about, trying to find my way through the world, and it's been a ripping good time. I've got a good job now, one that will eventually afford me a great deal of freedom, assuming I don't get tied down with a wife and kids and mortgage and all the trappings of modern life that are really just a trap. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It's a curve though. I'm starting at zero: zero knowledge of the stuff I'm doing, zero time to do anything but sleep and work, zero money, and zero photos taken since I started the job on tuesday. these will all help each other though: As I learn the job, I'll have more time to get out and do things; as soon as I have a paycheck, I'll have more money in hand than I've had in months; and of course, there will be more photos. (I just checked; there are a couple photos on the camera, but nothing of consequence). &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;one thing, I guess: I've realized that you don't have to be all one thing; that is, you can do a lot of different things, do them well, and it's not that you're letting go of one thing for another, it's that you're able to do both, and that all of your activities inform one another. It's a good thing I've come to this realization, because it's a really bad time to be trying to make money off of photography. (I'm not going to go into details, but someone was pissed at me recently because they thought I was putting out a certain photo for a profit, and it made me laugh. I've never made money off of what I consider my real work, the portraits, the documentary projects, etc). </description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 06 Nov 2009 05:52:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/11/06/what-s-next/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/11/06/what-s-next/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>The Morning after...</title>
          <description>So these are the last of them, except a coupla skate sequences... This was fun. And now, I've got a regular job, I'm going to be boring, but the good news is it's at least interesting work... learning a new programming language, plus a library or two, plus a new super complicated framework... all marketable skills, things I can use to get a job telecommuting from anywhere. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&quot;hey guys, let's go get food and make a big brunch.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0072.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Made their money back, at least. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0073.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Feast in preparation. Man that shit was epic and delicious.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0074.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;What's that they're passing around? Oh yeah, hair of the dog.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0075.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Sacrifices to the party gods.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0076.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0077.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Timmy said &quot;Man, if I hadn't done these tricks a million times, I wouldn't be able to do them right now.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0078.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;For some people, the party never stops.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0079.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 04 Nov 2009 01:50:00 GMT</pubDate>

        <item>
          <title>so I lied...</title>
          <description>I was going to just be lazy and post the photos to flickr and be done, but some of these need captions and comments and snarkiness. Also, I think more people will see them this way. These are split into three posts, so as not to hurt your page load time and my bandwidth.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Oh yeah, a technical note- these pictures wouldn't have been possible without clever deployment of the on camera flash and a little reflector to bounce it off of the ceiling/walls. If you want to learn stuff like that, why not come to &lt;a href=&quot;http://services.okccoco.com/classes/detail/50&quot;&gt;the class I'm teaching at the coco next week&lt;/a&gt;? /blatant plug.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Getting ready to race. Tanner hadn't ridden a bike in two months and took fourth.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;At my checkpoint, I made them do pushups. &quot;I hate you,&quot; Cody said, as he jumped back on his bike. He went on to win the race.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Brian said his costume was rock and roll jesus, something like that, but looking at it now, I can't help but think of him as Spider jerusalem on his jesus binge. All the comic book nerds know what I'm talking about.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Unfortunately, both dominatrixpizza.com and hotgirlseatingpizza.com are taken.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This is what happens when you run smack into a car that doesn't give you your right of way.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The look on her face is really worse than the bruise and small hematoma he had.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;No comment.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Hey Look! The flash will make it all right.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/hal09/0031.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That's it for now. tune in next time for more fun, excitement, and references you'll have to google to get.</description>

        <item>
          <title>Open Beta After Party</title>
          <description>I'm not going to bore you, my more general audience, with event photos of Open Beta. The fun stuff, as always, was at the afterparty. This person has especially delicate privacy issues (read: other journalists might be interested in harming him and his, and that's not what these photos are for), and I have to respect that.         <item>
          <title>A brief post about bicycles</title>
          <description>just to frustrate the people waiting for KRONDOR pictures. Don't worry, I'm onto that next, I'm even skipping the openbeta stuff to get to it. But anyway: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The Science Museum (their real name, no kidding) here in the city has a little exhibit on antique bicycles, or the development of the bike, or something like that. Really cool, I want two of everything they have on display. including that steam powered bike. that's pretty rad. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Lori looks at an original boneshaker. She was there on assignment from to see some exhibit in the photo hall of fame, and got me in for free.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/antique/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Harley moped with suicide shifter! OMG.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/antique/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Steampunk bike. Or is is still steampunk when it's actually a steam engine?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/antique/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I would ride the hell outta this wooden fixie piece of awesome.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/antique/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 27 Oct 2009 16:40:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/10/27/a-brief-post-about-bicycles/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/10/27/a-brief-post-about-bicycles/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>it's been days since....</title>
          <description>I last posted, and these photos aren't what everybody is waiting on, but hey, all the selects are made, now all I have to do is go through and color balance and adjust some exposure, and everything will be wonderful. Meantime, here are these, which have been sitting on my hard drive for a week, waiting for me to have a working display again. There's a long saga involved, but I really don't feel like going into my broken laptop problems. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/weekbefore/0001.jpg&quot;         <item>
          <title>wow I'm way behind....</title>
          <description>blame it on the busted macbook (parts are on their way from hong kong, and we all know how long it takes a slow boat from china to get here...) or blame it on being bummed about not getting the magazine job I thought I was a shoe-in for, or, well, general laziness, but anyway, here are some pics from sunday before last, more shooting for the &lt;a href=&quot;http://thenakedsun.com&quot;&gt;naked sun&lt;/a&gt;, which is still in progress and might actually be the saving of us all, if by us all I mean media/art people that would like to make money and keep on doing our thing at the same time. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nakedsunouttakes/0001.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nakedsunouttakes/0002.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nakedsunouttakes/0003.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nakedsunouttakes/0004.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>last of the saturday photos, and a weird thing that just happened</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This dude's name was Izzy. I think.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0023.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, I was just riding my bike around, the middle of the night being the best time for it, and I happened to turn down in to a neighborhood. I thought maybe there would be a way through to the next block, and sometimes there are even people out on their porches, partying, and that's always good for a drink or two. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This chick put on an awesome impromptu set. I'd listen to her again, even buy a cd, if I knew who she was of if she had recordings. Anybody know? edit to add: several people have told me that this is Ali harter. Thanks.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0024.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I couldn't have been more wrong. I mean, the neighborhood was all dead end cul de sacs and turned in on itself- the way I came in was the only way in or out. It was &lt;span &gt;quiet&lt;/span&gt;, too. Like zombie movie quiet, all the houses dark, not even a television flickering that I saw. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Ed and Victoria.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0025.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I kept cruising, slowly, looking for some sign of life. I was about to give up and leave the neighborhood, and three big dogs jumped out of their doghouse, running and barking. Then, I saw the fence between me and them, and pressed down the little panic reflex. Not wanting to push my luck, I got the hell out of that weird neighborhood.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Katie, no metal face.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0026.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And then I found five dollars. (Not really, but Alex told me to say that when I tell a story that has no real point, so people don't feel cheated for reading it). &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I think he name is Meg? (edit: jennifer. not even close there, bub. ther real question: where do I know a meg zinkly?). Cool chick, does good designs.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0027.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 07 Oct 2009 05:38:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/10/07/last-of-the-saturday-photos-and-a-weird-thing-that-just-happened/</guid>

        <item>
          <title>Plaza district fest part 1</title>
          <description>I'm splitting these into multiple parts, because I think they'll work better that way, and because I say so. Nyah.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;hangin' out on the roof deck at Victoria's.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0001.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0002.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;LOW-ANGLE SHOTS ARE COOLER AT 18MM.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/plazadistfest/0003.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Creepiest Halloween decoration I';ve seen so far this year.           <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/10/06/plaza-district-fest-part-1/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/10/06/plaza-district-fest-part-1/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>being lost</title>
          <description>Yesterday or the day before, sunday, anyway, I was driving down the highway and I had this sudden feeling of disconnectedness, of being lost. Like when in the night you wake up and don't know where you are. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I was coming around a curve, and it was raining, cloudy, but I know that section of road, have driven it many times. There's the normal state of having been somewhere, and you remember, for example, that the bathroom is behind you and your car is out in the parking lot or driveway, and that the roads that led you there also lead to home. It's a grounded feeling, a feeling that lets you ignore parts of the landscape that aren't normal. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;For a brief second, coming around that curve, it was like all those connections, where I was going and where I was coming from, and everything that I knew the location of, all of that was cut off, and it was as if I was floating above it. It's so odd because I normally have a very good sense of the space I'm in and what is around me. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then, I looked around I saw every detail of everything, blades of grass and tree branches, and the cars a quarter mile back, and the shapes of the clouds, and then, gradually, over a period of ten seconds, the feeling faded, and while I didn't feel really normal for a couple minutes, the hyper-awareness was gone and the highway was just highway, and the sky was just sky, and the weirdness went away, just like it does when you turn on the light in the middle of the night.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, now back to your regularly scheduled blog. There's some nice pics from plaza fest and outtakes from the naked sun shoot coming up, so stay tuned. </description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 06 Oct 2009 01:47:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/10/06/being-lost/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/10/06/being-lost/</link>
        </item>

          <title>Some opolis show or something</title>
          <description>Friday was fun as shit. Definitely the best night out I've had in a while that didn't involve getting far too drunk. Actually, there was drinking, of course. But the funness was from the dancing and the company, Amber and Kat and some of their friends, oh yeah, and I saw Grizzly Bear's tour bus.  At least, that's what someone said it was. No idea who these bands were, forgot their names already, go to the opolis web site and look i9f you care, but they honestly weren't that great, or I would have written the names down or shot the poster or something.           <title>The Opposite Signs... another band post...</title>
          <description>I swear I'm not turning into &lt;a href=&quot;http://jeremycharles.com&quot;&gt;Jeremy Charles&lt;/a&gt;, or worse, Annie Leibowitz, but I do seem to be shooting a lot of musicians lately. This band I didn't really like. The sound was super mellow, smooth jazz like, and it really did nothing for me. There were some good moments, when it seemed like a song would break out and do something interesting, but then it got drowned in the hopeless drone. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sleepdepweekend/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sleepdepweekend/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sleepdepweekend/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sleepdepweekend/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Romantic Disaster at HiLo</title>
          <description>Romantic disaster is a local band that's doing amazing things. They've got a great sound and a great look, the kind that even comes through when they're all wasted and playing a quick set at an AIDS benefit show at a dive like the HiLo. In fact, it probably added to the rawness and unpredictability of the whole thing. Of course, your humble blogger was drunk off his ass, so maybe I was just responding to the visceral loudness and hotness of their lead singer. But I've heard them play before, when I was sober and so were they, and they're good. Put them on your list of bands to catch, and then someday, you can be like, &quot;I saw them in this tiny ass club in OKC. The bassist used to make my pizza.&quot; Oh wait, that's me. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/romanticdisaster/0018.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/romanticdisaster/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/romanticdisaster/0014.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Norman Bike against Hunger Alleycat</title>

        <item>
          <title>what? 300 posts!</title>
          <description>Yeah, I'm as shocked as you are. Some of those are drafts that were never published, but still... a year and a half and three hundred posts later, we're still here. Wow. This one sort of snuck up me. It seems like just a couple weeks ago I had the 250th post. But no. Anyway, some random photos before we get to fair stuff and bike race later today.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;I don't have enough superlatives for the meal I had at Musashi's last thursday. The show was fun, but the kobe beef there is tied for the best steak I've ever had. The fried rice was also really good. I like places that pay attention to their staples.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/allatonce/0003.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Yeah, ooh, pretty fire.         <item>
          <title>Opolis show</title>
          <description>Went down to norman with Chelsea (and now she has a twitter so I can link that: &lt;a href=&quot;http://twitter.com/thenakedsun&quot;&gt;@thenakedsun&lt;/a&gt;) and took photos of the band &quot;Deer People&quot; (or is that &quot;The Deer People&quot;?) and anyway, hated the photos when I first looked, but really these aren't that bad. There's a second band down there, Mayola, they were good too. Louder and more energetic, but a lot simpler musically. I liked both. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;On the way to Norman.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0024.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Oh yeah, there were random firedancers.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0025.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;And then the sky opened up. And it rained a lot.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0026.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Like, really a lot, even for a place where the rain has been going for two weeks.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0027.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And then there were the bands.
