          <pubDate>Mon, 21 Sep 2009 14:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/21/just-some-pics/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/21/just-some-pics/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>for the haters</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0053.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I've been showing the draft or proof copy of the book around, and there have been some comments made about my selection of images. I'm only going to say this once, so read carefully:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0054.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0055.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I didn't pick the pictures for whatever reason you're thinking. This book is the result of 5 different edits, three of which were complete restarts from the original 25,000 pictures. It took me 6 months to get this far, a herculean task if there ever was one, so you really won't ever get the full reasoning behind what is in the book. Photographers and picture editors reading this, if you've ever had a 25,000 picture project all in your head, will understand what I'm talking about. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0056.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0057.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;There are two reasons I put pictures in the book: either they told a part of the story, I thought they were a good picture, or more usually, both. Of the individual portraits, I tried not to have more than two or three of anybody, and I think I did that... but there are also pictures that are more about the things that are happening, and I didn't really think about who was in those at all. Except I did, kinda. The second edit featured a couple of people more prominently, and I actually trashed that one because I didn't like the way it felt with those people at the front. It's not about any one person, or any three, but about an indefinite number somewhere between 20 and 50, about what you can fit into a two bedroom apartment for a decent party. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0058.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0059.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That said, I think I'm going to go back and write little vignettes about the pictures... not captions, but stories to go with them. Not for all of them, but for some of them. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0060.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0061.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Note for these photos: they're all from last wednesday, there's more coming, a lot more, I have an infinite backlog right now actually. Too much other stuff going on to post, but I'm trying now. There was an unintentional hiatus while I was sick and an intentional one the past couple days, but I'm officially back. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0062.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/goingbackwards/0063.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 21 Sep 2009 04:15:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/21/for-the-haters/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/21/for-the-haters/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>am I late to the party, or is this just awesome?</title>
          <description>&lt;object width=&quot;560&quot; height=&quot;340&quot;&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;movie&quot; value=&quot;http://www.youtube.com/v/M7QSkI6My1g&amp;hl=en&amp;fs=1&amp;&quot;&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;allowFullScreen&quot; value=&quot;true&quot;&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;allowscriptaccess&quot; value=&quot;always&quot;&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;embed src=&quot;http://www.youtube.com/v/M7QSkI6My1g&amp;hl=en&amp;fs=1&amp;&quot; type=&quot;application/x-shockwave-flash&quot; allowscriptaccess=&quot;always&quot; allowfullscreen=&quot;true&quot; width=&quot;560&quot; height=&quot;340&quot;&gt;&lt;/embed&gt;&lt;/object&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;right?           <pubDate>Fri, 11 Sep 2009 03:51:00 GMT</pubDate>

        <item>
          <title>Norman Playground</title>
          <description>So to put a capper on an unbelievably amazing day, we went down to norman, where Amber and her fiancee Josh fed us cake and roast and squash. Even the squash was good, and I've never like it in the past. Might have to revise that sentiment now. Anyway, we watched a movie, something weird with Zooey Deschanel and some dude adopting a baby from china.Weird ending, but I think I liked it. Then we all went to the park, where it was very dark. Too dark to focus using normal methods; zen methods were employed with some success. As sharp as can be, considering 1/10th of a second at f/1.2 and ISO 25000. You don't believe me, you go out and try it. Anyway, pictures:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0022.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Chelsea took this one, she said I needed pics of myself on my birthday. Here's me playing on a playground at 25 years.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0023.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;And here's the playground, also by her.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0024.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Amber, looking at Josh in the foreground.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0025.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0026.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 09 Sep 2009 18:56:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/09/norman-playground/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/09/norman-playground/</link>

        <item>
          <title>25th Birthday, photoshoot, awesomeness</title>
          <description>Basically last sunday was one of the best days I've ever had, right up there with my 20th birthday, the day I graduated high school, and the field day at summer arts' institute. Might even be the best, what with all the excellent madness and amazing people and things. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I woke up and went home, had a good breakfast with the family, eggs, home fries, bacon, the kind of meal you dream of later. Then I coordinated with Chelsea and Meaghan for the shoot later that day (don't cheat, there's tons of story before we get to those pictures). We were going to go to Stillwater and make a big production, but Maeghan had cut her foot badly the night before. She didn't want to cancel, so I suggested we scale back, just do one of the ideas and do it here in the city. So we did, and chelsea came down and met us at Sauced. Cyrus showed up on his motorbike (dubbed the aluminum falcon because it's also a piece of crap) and said hello and whatnot, and then jetted, and so did we. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0015.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We found a place to do the painting, over at Grant (&lt;a href=&quot;http://twitter.com/schofield&quot;&gt;@schofield&lt;/a&gt;) and Damaris' (&lt;a href=&quot;http://twitter.com/somna&quot;&gt;@somna&lt;/a&gt;) house, but they weren't going to be home, so we went in search of coffee, and failed. What we did find, Sara Sara, was downright creepy. But their cupcakes were decent and the milk bar was brilliant. They need to work on their coffee offerings though. Real espresso would be nice.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0016.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then I waited, while Maeghan did the work and Chelsea sat very still. This is what the waiting was like: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0017.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Now add to that 20 mosquito bites, and I decided to go inside to wait. This is what the girls were up to:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0018.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And later: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0019.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And finally, on location, swatting a bee: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0020.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And the final silhouette: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/moremore/0021.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;There's another picture up at &lt;a href=&quot;http://thenakedsun.com&quot;&gt;The Naked Sun&lt;/a&gt; our literary journal. That's right, I said &quot;our&quot;- I'm one of the editors and web designer, and if everybody is half as cool as then seem, and can manage to meet deadlines, we're going to be the raddest thing out there. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;From the shoot, we dropped Maeghan off to go get her foot checked out, and headed to Norman for cake and more adventures. Tune in in a coupla hours, and there'll be more pics.</description>

          <title>Another Monday</title>
          <description>Monday rolls around and I'm looking for polaroid film when who should call me but &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.furburger.org&quot;&gt;Christa May&lt;/a&gt;, wondering if I'm down for a little libation at Mcnellie's. Of course I am. I'm always down for Mcnellie's.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Logan and Matt, not me, but Christa's new dude. Isn't it nice how everyone seems to be forming couples at the same time? Oh yeah, that's my job.         <item>
          <title>Location, Location</title>
          <description>Sunday was location scouting. And thrift stores. And a nondisclosure agreement, so I'm not sure what I can and can't say, but none of these are embargoed, formally or informally, so there you have it. We're working on cool shit, and when it comes out it's going to be really rad, but that's not for four months or so, so expect teasers and hints and nothing substantive until at least january.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/locationscouting/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Credit where credit is due: photo by Chelsea M'lynn.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/locationscouting/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/locationscouting/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/locationscouting/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/locationscouting/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Sherree Chamberlain</title>
          <description>This is the band and the singer/songwriter that the crew that I was there to photograph was there to film. Wait, let me rephrase. I showed up and my friend Tomee was there with a film crew to record Sherree and her band, and Tomee asked me if I would shoot some production stills, so I did. And I got backstage access for the whole show, and some nice pictures; My friend and fellow photographer &lt;a href=&quot;http://jeremycharles.com&quot;&gt;Jeremy Charles&lt;/a&gt; said something on twitter about the joy of the performer being why he does concert photography, and I saw what he meant shooting these pictures. I shouldn't be surprised that he also has a &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.jeremycharles.com/blog/index.php/2009/05/27/sherree-chamberlain-photos/&quot;&gt;gallery&lt;/a&gt; of photos of Chamberlain too. Dude knows what's up. Girl can sing and entertain and has the look too. &lt;br /&gt; &lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sherreechamberlin/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sherreechamberlin/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sherreechamberlin/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sherreechamberlin/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sherreechamberlin/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sherreechamberlin/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Random friends</title>
          <description>Hopefully I can be forgiven for sandwiching these photos of some friends I ran into at the concert in between band posts... these are cool people, as far as I know. I mean, I'm not their mother, so I can't be a character witness, but at least they knew where the cool show was in stillwater that night and made it out, so that says something. And some of them, the ones I know better, are verified badass. So, guilt by association with me:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/concertfriends/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/concertfriends/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/concertfriends/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Uglysuit</title>
          <description>So last saturday and sunday I was in stillwater for various reasons including location scouting and &quot;for the hell of it.&quot; I rolled out of OKC at 9pm, right after work, and rolled into stillwater at around 10, rolling right up to a show and betting an assignment for production stills in the first five minutes of being there. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, I'm getting out of the car and combobulating myself (grabbing my camera and checking the settings and making sure I have an extra battery and card) and I hear the band that's playing, don't know who it is, but they sound good. Then I walk in and recognize Uglysuit on stage. Fucking good show. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/uglysuitstillwater/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 02 Sep 2009 19:16:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/02/uglysuit/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/02/uglysuit/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>One picture</title>
          <description>There's a story in news-photographer apocrypha about an old school photographer who went out on assignment to someplace very remote; say, China. Mongolia. Now this guy was old school to our old school; learned to photograph with a 4x5 and knew a time when lens caps doubled as shutters. He went to China with a new nikon 35mm and when he got back, as he was deplaning, an assistant for whatever paper he was working for met him just off the plane to rush his film to the lab. He pulls out his camera, rewinds the roll that's inside, and hands it to the assistant, saying &quot;Print 'em both, kid.&quot;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Now, I'm not a fan of the slow, patient photography that this implies; neither am I a proponent of going out to an event and overheating a motor drive taking way too many pictures. I like to take a series of pictures that tells the story over time. But there is something to be said for being patient, and taking less pictures. The night I took this photo, I took two; this one and one of the inside of my bag as I was putting the camera away. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/onepic/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Now I have to go and edit the pictures from the next night, where I shot 500 pictures in a couple hours. There's a lot going on here at matt mills world HQ, so stay tuned.</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 02 Sep 2009 14:59:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/02/one-picture/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/02/one-picture/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Code for a Cause comes to CoCo</title>
          <description>So saturday was a busy day, spent mostly recovering from friday in the morning, but I did manage to stop by the &lt;a href=&quot;www.okccoco.com&quot;&gt;CoCo&lt;/a&gt; for a minute to snap a few pictures of code for a cause, a really neat charity that provieds web site makeovers for nonprofits. 600 hours of web design and coding all compressed into one day. Pretty awesome. Wish I could have stayed longer. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/cfac/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/cfac/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/cfac/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/cfac/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/cfac/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 02 Sep 2009 02:06:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/02/code-for-a-cause-comes-to-coco/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/09/02/code-for-a-cause-comes-to-coco/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Big Truck Tacos</title>
          <description>So, back when I was trying to start a city blog for okc, and at the same time still blogging here and doing my best imitation of a fish's drinking habits, I had a series that would have been titled &quot;I love it here&quot;- reviews of good shit here in OKC that would have been a regular feature if the blog had had more than three readers. Shows you how good I am at promotion. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The inside of the place is nicely decorated, with good seating.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bigtruck/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I had a couple steak al carbon tacos, a mexican coke, and chips and salsa. The tacos were good, not too greasy, with corn tortillas and onions for flavor. About that flavor: I wish I could say it was on par with other places I've had tacos locally, (I'm looking at you, Iguana, with all your deliciousness) but there just wasn't enough. All I got was beef and onion, no spice. That said, they were good, and with the salsa, not bad at all. The chips and salsa were chips and salsa, good and fresh. A word on Mexican Coke: you should try it. They use real cane sugar to make it, which has a better flavor than high fructose bullshit. Really better than what you get out of the fountain. I think I paid 9 bucks for the meal, and I was pretty satisfied when I was done. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Any place with patio seating is a win in this town. We Okies like to dine al fresco.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bigtruck/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, Big Truck Tacos would have been a natural fit for that series. They're a locally owned newish place, right in the middle of the part of 23rd street that I was betting would see development 6 months ago... and here we are, already a new restaurant. And they're good. Great patio seating, nice atmos inside, fast service, friendly staff, and that awesome location,  they've got all the stuff they need lined up to be a success. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Not a food photographer. But doesn't this look good? Needs more seasoning to be perfect, though.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bigtruck/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Definitely recommended, and you'll probably see me there trying out more menu items as the weeks progress.</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 27 Aug 2009 17:37:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/08/27/big-truck-tacos/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/08/27/big-truck-tacos/</link>
        </item>

        <item>
          <title>The Morning After</title>
          <description>This is the last of the pics from last weekend. Man, that was epic. I'm basically doing two jobs, but only getting paid for one; I'm a lowly barista, and I'm a photographer, shooting all the time and editing when I can, around my social and work schedule. It's actually pretty fun, I just don't sleep a lot these days. Never did sleep much though. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That morning, though, I woke up and felt fine; six whole hours of sleep does wonders, even when there's half a bottle of rum involved. then we did brunch at Cafe do Brasil. They really have the best sunday brunch, and my favorite chorizo in town. Then onto sauced to hang out on the patio and soak up the sun on a gorgeous day. A fantastic end to a really great weekend. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Chelsea stretching. I love the lines in this one; odd parallels you don't expect take a second to resolve. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0038.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Again with Chelsea. Did I mention she's also gorgeous? Yeah. Now I have.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0039.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Pearl looking all stoic and really not hungover.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0040.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This puppy was cute as hell. And obviously sent by the devil to enslave us all.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0041.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;See? It took Pearl right in with its pink belly. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0043.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Obviously Dangerous.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0044.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>MYL Chelsea's After Party Photos</title>
          <description>I first met &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0033.jpg&quot;&gt;Chelsea&lt;/a&gt; at the bike prom on friday- she seemed interesting in a &quot;you're a person with interesting ideas&quot; kind of way, then she showed up here in the city for Made You Look and the afterparty, and turns out we're into a lot of the same things, photography and journalism and documentary work, and we're getting along famously at the party when she asks to see my camera, and I hand it over (this is after several stout rum and cokes, mind), and she runs off taking pictures like there's no tomorrow. And I don't know, something about the way I can see she's concentrating, I let her keep going with it for a while. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'm really glad I did because she's really good. Focus is on the money, compositionally interesting, good moments, the whole bit. I asked her later, after seeing the pictures, if she had any experience. &quot;I just shoot everything I love. Always have,&quot; she tells me. And that's exactly it folks, what I've been saying for years: shoot what you love, the rest is just technicalities. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0014.jpg&quot;         <item>
          <title>Made You Look</title>
          <description>First off, a video: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;object width=&quot;640&quot; height=&quot;358&quot;&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;allowfullscreen&quot; value=&quot;true&quot; /&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;allowscriptaccess&quot; value=&quot;always&quot; /&gt;&lt;param name=&quot;movie&quot; value=&quot;http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=6277295&amp;amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;amp;show_title=1&amp;amp;show_byline=1&amp;amp;show_portrait=0&amp;amp;color=&amp;amp;fullscreen=1&quot; /&gt;&lt;embed src=&quot;http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=6277295&amp;amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;amp;show_title=1&amp;amp;show_byline=1&amp;amp;show_portrait=0&amp;amp;color=&amp;amp;fullscreen=1&quot; type=&quot;application/x-shockwave-flash&quot; allowfullscreen=&quot;true&quot; allowscriptaccess=&quot;always&quot; width=&quot;640&quot; height=&quot;358&quot;&gt;&lt;/embed&gt;&lt;/object&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://vimeo.com/6277295&quot;&gt;B Boy Sequence II&lt;/a&gt; from &lt;a href=&quot;http://vimeo.com/user932074&quot;&gt;Matt Mills&lt;/a&gt; on &lt;a href=&quot;http://vimeo.com&quot;&gt;Vimeo&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then, just a few stills not in that sequence. The battle was decent, but I missed most of it, jumped up on stage with Chelsea (who you'll be hearing a lot more about in a little bit) and squeezed a spot with a view of the dance floor. Kicked some dudes bag out of the way. It was good to see the little part that I saw; the show was so small this year I wondered why they bothered. The art was all pretty decent, but nothing stuck with me. There should have been more, in more space. Bricktown wasn;t the place to have it, people. Anyway, photos: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/madeyoulookandafter/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Up next will be photos of the afterparty, which was way more epic.</description>

        <item>
          <title>BIKE PROM</title>
          <description>I was going to be all cool and separate thes out into three or four posts, but I realized there's no reason to do that, because I've got a ton more posts coming, including a review of big truck tacos, some fliks from made you look 09, and crazy sunday with puppies. So, without further delay, bikeprom (and yes, I'm being lazy by not adding captions, but most of these are self explanatory):&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bikeprom/0001.jpg&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bikeprom/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;           <description>So I have a huge pile of photos from the last week, and I've been procrastinating on posting them because of work and lazyness and such, but here, finally, on a coffee fueled sunday night, I've gotten them all out and will post them in blog-sized chunks until I get bored with them and post all the rest in a large-ish post sometime on tuesday.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Mom on her first day as a retiree.         <item>
          <title>Another Norman Saturday Night</title>
          <description>I felt kinda really off shooting saturday, ended up dancing as much as photographing. That's what I get for eating a whole hot n ready sausage pizza. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This girl had everything I look for in a woman: 1. a camera 2. madness 3. the tendency to flip shit and run off.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/anothernormansat/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Cameron, also late of BROQUEST, although he finished in a different place. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/anothernormansat/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was a complete accident. I like it.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/anothernormansat/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was completely on purpose. I like it as well.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/anothernormansat/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/anothernormansat/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The morning after... It's funny how few pictures I have of scenes like this, when it happens to me all the time. Expect that to change in the weeks to come.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/anothernormansat/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        </item>
    
        <item>

        <item>
          <title>Technical difficulties...</title>
          <description>For those of you paying attention, there has been a little hiatus, a delay, a mini vacation even... I felt like death for 48 hours, and I still have something of a sore throat, but I think I'm going to be all right. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nancysmonday/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;These pics are from Monday; Lori texted me from work, asking me to get people up there, so I did; &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.furburger.org&quot;&gt;Christa&lt;/a&gt; and Jonathan came out and had drinks. It's sort of a hellish job, working in a karaoke bar; I hope Lori gets something else soon. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nancysmonday/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, I like my new job so far. It's actually challenging to steam milk. I still don't really have a grasp of what I'm really doing, but that will come in time. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nancysmonday/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And for those of you that have read this far down, a surprise: Booze cruise is happening this Friday, 9pm. The plan is to do two rounds at each bar, so we can keep some kind of momentum. Starting at the rooster, have a couple pitchers, then to the drunken fry, because I really want to try that truffle shit, and then to nancy's, so we can all get banned from yet another karaoke bar. I'm going to be annoying everyone in my phone/twitter followers about this too for the next couple days, hopefully enough people come out. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nancysmonday/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>ISO 25,000</title>
          <description>So this is crazy, really wild, I mean, talk about no light, some of these are taken in the reflected mirror ball light off a black wall, just insanely no light at all, but here are the pictures. This is going to be fun. I'm playing around at ISO 25k, which is just unheard of, it's so noisy it's an extra level of abstraction. Focus is &quot;guess and get lucky sometimes,&quot; other times it's just blurry and that doesn't really hurt things because these pictures aren't about detail but about energy and tone and exploring places that heretofore were invisible to the camera, and a lot of times to the eye. These are places people go but not places that are easily seen unless you go there, at least until now. Enough ramble. The photos!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/ISO25K/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/ISO25K/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/ISO25K/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/ISO25K/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/ISO25K/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/ISO25K/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/ISO25K/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Make-a-wish Has a Rock Show</title>
          <description>Sometime Last week I found out that some of my friends from highschool were doing a benefit show for Make-a-Wish Foundation, and they needed a photographer. So, I ent and shot a few things, didn't stay the whole night. The first band was really shitty, the same three chords, all at the same tempo, and the same one note drone from the lead singer for every song. It was boring and shitty. then Hundresomethings came on, and well, they were better. They still lack a little edge, I don't know what they need, but it's not bad to hear live. Then I had to go. The good news: they raised over $2k last night. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/makeawish/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/makeawish/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/makeawish/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/makeawish/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/makeawish/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/makeawish/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/makeawish/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/08/02/okccoco-has-an-artshow/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Why magnum needs a blog</title>
          <description>Ok, so go read &lt;a href=&quot;http://blog.magnumphotos.com/2009/07/the_future_of_the_magnum_blog.html&quot;&gt;this statement from Magnum Photo's blog&lt;/a&gt;. The gist of it is, they aren't blogging for the foreseeable future, and might not blog ever again. The reason they give is that blogs aren't a good platform for quality content. It's offensive and wrong-headed, to say the least. Even if/when they do come back, if it's as several blogs or as one feed, if the focus becomes more about dialogue than content, I think they're missing something big.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedela/0001.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;To say that blogs aren't a good place for quality content is &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.todayandtomorrow.net/&quot;&gt;ignorant&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.americansuburbx.com/&quot;&gt;and&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;http://curatedby.jon-kyle.com/&quot;&gt;misinformed&lt;/a&gt;. (Links go to rebuttal examples.&lt;a href=&quot;http://www.burnmagazine.org/&quot;&gt;Also this&lt;/a&gt;). Those are all blogs, all that I've come across recently; there are countless sources of good content on the web, places that have really brilliant content, displayed well. The last one is a community effort, and in fact arose because of a group of people looking for a place. So, to shut down a blog to build a community seems silly. Why not blog the process of making the new site?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedela/0002.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Why aren't the photographers of Magnum, surely some of the world's finest visual storytellers, blogging themselves? (With the notable exception of David Allen Harvey, who runs Burn magazine, of course). It'd be the best group blog ever, if they would embrace a little technology; the best eyes in the world, reporting daily what they see. From the perspective of one who does it, who has done it now for going on two years (with a little hiatus between the end of the santa fe blog and the start of this one), it's not hard at all to knock out a blog post a day, sometimes two or three. Especially if all it consists of are photos with captions. Every other day is even easier; even when I was working full time at a job that had nothing to do with my photography, I still did that.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedela/0003.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I guess part of the problem is that to get a group of photographers to do anything together is something like herding cats; if you've ever walked in a city with even four or five of us you know what I'm talking about; it takes two or three times as long to get somewhere (even dinner) because the whole group sort of wanders off after a picture, and then the rest have to wait, and by the time the one gets back someone else has wandered off. Now imagine a group like that, all self-interested, agreeing to do something like a group blog, to share space on the web with anyone else?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedela/0004.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Thinking that way is really wrong-headed. Separate channels for each photographer presume that each one is doing enough to hold a reader's interest indefinitely, and that readers of one photographer won't be interested in others. It's silly. The truth is, group blogs of like minded people (or at least people who are all talking about the same things) usually have more readers and better content than single author blogs. Think &lt;a href=&quot;http://laist.com/&quot;&gt;LAist&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;a href=&quot;http://boingboing.net/&quot;&gt;BoingBoing&lt;/a&gt;, or blogs like that. The rising tide lifts all boats. And, because there are other people out there doing the same thing in the same space, you're apt to learn and improve your own content as time goes on.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img  src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedela/0005.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Of course, nobody listens to me, or at least nobody at Magnum.</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 30 Jul 2009 20:55:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/30/why-magnum-needs-a-blog/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/30/why-magnum-needs-a-blog/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Photography as a New Liberal Art</title>
          <description>This is not a post about taking photographs, but about looking at them, reading them, and understanding what they are and are not. If you want to know about taking photos, there's a ton of good literature out there. There is a whole subset of phototographers who think that the techniques of photography (exposure, sharpness, depth, grain/noise, etc) are an end unto themselves, but this is a false path. But the fact that they exist and are there to tell us what the rules are so we can break them effectively is a good thing. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The idea of &quot;New Liberal Arts&quot; comes from &lt;a href=&quot;http://snarkmarket.com/&quot;&gt;Snarkmarket&lt;/a&gt; and their interesting if incomplete book &lt;a href=&quot;http://snarkmarket.com/nla/&quot;&gt;New Liberal Arts&lt;/a&gt;, which is based around the idea that to function intelligently in society today, there is a new skillset outside of the traditional lines of the liberal arts. The main point of learning liberal arts is to learn how to think critically about the world.  Since it's my area, and since the chapter in the book is one of the areas that comes up short, I thought some expansion was called for in the area of thinking critically about photographs. These are all just starting points, ideas, and not rules forever. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The first most important consideration when looking at a photograph is the content of the picture. A photo is a two-d simulacra of the 4-d world; It takes a cone of space (the angle of view) and a slice of time (the shutter speed) and reduces that to an image on a piece of paper, or more commonly now, a screen. There are parts in and out of focus, there is a limit to the detail that can be seen (and no software, no matter what CSI tells you, can bring back detail from a pixelated image). There is a perspective, and by this I mean a camera position, high or low, close to the subject or far away. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;What does this mean to us, the viewer? Any rendering of a scene is only a partial rendering; at any given time there are an infinite number of perspectives and the same infinite gradation of moments that the camera can have, and we are seeing only one. I am categorically opposed to the idea that all of these perspectives are equal (relativism be damned, it's solipsism with a coat of postmodern paint). Some moments are better than others, and if that weren't the case, there would be no art in photography. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;A photo can be evidence, it can tell a (short) story, but through selection of moments and perspectives, the photograph can tell a lie, too. It is impossible to tell by looking at a photograph if it is true or false. The only thing that can be determined is if it has been altered after the fact. This is why people are always so aghast when someone is caught photoshopping news pictures, because it disturbs their questionable belief in the veracity of the medium of photography. It's a religious belief, one which has no grounding in fact; you'd see similar responses if you went in front of a church congregation and gave them a logical proof of atheism (ask a Jesuit, they really do exist, but reality is not wholly logical anyway). &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, a photo can't be true or false from the perspective of a viewer, and here I'm only talking of candid pictures, not staged or manipulated after the fact. I can walk into a party and make 300 pictures, and just in the selection of what to show, make it look like the best party ever or the worst time anybody has ever had outside of torture chambers. Neither is true. Or they both might be.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Ok, that's all the lesson I have in me today. The important takeaway: a photo is never the whole story. Sometimes it's enough.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/dfest09/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 28 Jul 2009 17:16:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/28/photography-as-a-new-liberal-art/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/28/photography-as-a-new-liberal-art/</link>
        </item>

          <title>booze cruise: the return</title>
          <description>So last night was the first booze cruise I've been to in months... between time off the bike and booze cruise itself kind of dying out, it just hasn't happened. Unfortunately, the night was ruined at the end, the second or third stolen purse at blue note. Sucks. The photos weren't all that great, I wasn't really focused, but as always, there are a few cool things.         <item>
          <title>just a quick post</title>
          <description>before I rush out to Mcnellies for 3 dolla burgers. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0014.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0016.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0017.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0018.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0019.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>starbux is giving away pastries</title>
          <description>And I'm not drawn in by their evil conspiracy. It's taken years, but now they're finally making a move. Wake up, Sheeple! &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;(At least one person reading this will get the joke. The rest of you, don't worry, I'm not any more unhinged than I ever was).&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'm writing this from my restored and much loved macbook. Friday night, before I went out to shoot these pictures, I was leaning over my desk to grab my bike off of the wall, and I knocked over a 16oz cup of coffee right into the computer. I knew there was nothing I could really do then; the best thing to do is let it dry first. So I did, I went off to the party, had a good time, (moar hellkats=more good times), and rode home. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Next day, I tried to restart it, no dice, so I opened it up and there was a ton of gunk on everything, of course. Coffee+2.5yrs of dust, pretty much. Disheartened, I gave up and went to Mcnellies to be attacked by the photographer from lookatOKC. No, I don't want my picture taken. No, I won't sign a release. Go talk to the wedding party. It's my own fault for wearing my houndstooth fedora; that thing draws attention like whoa. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Paperazzi deflected (yeah, I'm aware of the irony, but at least I know the people I take pictures of), I went home, and little elves hadn't come in and fixed my laptop, so the next day (sunday), I started dousing it with alcohol, and then I had the bright idea to get out a toothbrush and scrub away the crud. I let it dry overnight, plugged everything together, and it worked on the first try. Go me. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;also: the more I use my new camera, the more I love it. I've already shot 2000 photos with it. ok, fine, I'll shut up about it already. But the good news keeps on coming, I have a job interview tomorrow, I fixed this laptop, etc. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rideoutandback/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot;           <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/21/starbux-is-giving-away-pastries/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/21/starbux-is-giving-away-pastries/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>More D700. More Awesome.</title>
          <description>It's too early and I haven't had my coffee. So here, pictures without many words: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0007.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0010.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0011.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0012.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0013.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0014.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I can has... tongue?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0015.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0016.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0017.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>No, you can't tawe my picture</title>
          <description>dear lookatokc photographer,&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;No, you can't take my picture. Yes, I'm also a working photographer (for a given value of working), no, that doesn't mean we really have anything in common. You take party pics, i take pictures of my friends at parties. You use a flash when you don't need it, I hate it even when I absolutely have to use it. You have a huge camera bag weighing you down with shit you don't need, I only own two lenses. All of these are strikes against you, but really, it's just that I don't like having my picture taken. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Some of us don't want to be in the paper. I might be the only one, but I'd wager there are at least a few people out there who like anonymity. Or who need it. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Certainly there's little value in party pics, hell, I take thousands myself and put them on this shitty blog, but the big difference is that I know the people that I take pictures of, for the most part. I feel weird not knowing people and taking their picture. It's knowing the people that lets me get closer, get a little more meaning in the phototographs than the standard grin and grab-the-person-next-to-you. Some of them, at least (yes, there are a few posed pics here on the blog and more on my facebook, but those are here for the people in them, not for me to show off).&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Sun, 19 Jul 2009 07:43:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/19/no-you-can-t-tawe-my-picture/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/19/no-you-can-t-tawe-my-picture/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>post #250!</title>
          <description>Never though this blog would make it this long. But then I also thought I'd be long gone from oklahoma too. Anyway, It's been an interesting four days, to say the least. I got my new camera on wednesday, and I couldn't be happier with it. The D700 is an amazing machine; it makes everything that I do easier and pushes the realm of photographic possibility farther than I'd thought possible. Yeah, it's that good. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That was my first delay; I was having too much fun with the new camera to blog. Then the power went out in my neighborhood overnight, and there was no internet; then, finally, just as I got these photos edited, i spilled a coffee into my macbook, ruining it. so now they're re-edited, and here for your enjoyment. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Next post: look for the gratuitous cat photos (not what you think). &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0001.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0002.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0003.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0004.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0005.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/firstd700/0006.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>larry and his flask</title>
          <description>This band, Larry and his flask, is a crazy high energy bluegrass punk band. Good sound, but I didn't stay for the second set. I don't know, the blugrass part of their sound got annoying to me, but then I loved them for the first half. Go figure. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The guy with the base, though, I swear he was playing tourette's or something, different instruments every song, running around, throwing his base on the floor and then on a table, just crazy. Entertaining as hell. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/larryandhisflask/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/larryandhisflask/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/larryandhisflask/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/larryandhisflask/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/larryandhisflask/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/larryandhisflask/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/larryandhisflask/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, new camera's here, I'm playing with and and enjoying the hell out of it.         <item>
          <title>Norman B-day's and such</title>
          <description>another round of drinking and photos... this was one of those nights that sort of blurred together towards the end... really fun, though, and I woke up in time to head off the hangover with water. Protip: Water works best before you actually feel the hangover. If you already have a headache, you're going to suffer more. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, I rode my bike to get down there, 20 miles in 2.3 hours... terrible time, I know, but I did it, and that's the important part. There was a lot of terror and panic, and anger at everything with four wheels, but it's all part of the show at this point. I've just got to recondition myself, and that's going to take time. How long before I can ride ten miles in half an hour again? I don't know, probably a while. How long before I don't flinch every time a car passes is more important, and hopefully that'll be sooner. Pain and fatigue I can deal with, fear is harder.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Less seriously, though, the night was a blast. 2 hours of bike riding to get to 6 hours of party=8 good hours. For example:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Fabulous shoes.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;B-Bell in classic black and white.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Birthday Girl Shelby. Peep that bling.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;An infinity of bromance? No, I actually think they were headbutting or something. I did mention that things were blurry for me at the end of the night, right?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Traci and Casey, now roommates and rhyme-mates.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Incidentally, this is the same guy (mario, I think) who had the shoes. Makes me wonder: Are they clown shoes?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Shelby and Cody, and the damn taco bell cup I was sorely tempted to clone out. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;LOLWAT?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightinnorman/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, I've got a bike to ride and pictures that won't take themselves.</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 13 Jul 2009 15:39:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/13/norman-b-day-s-and-such/</guid>

        <item>
          <title>sometimes...</title>
          <description>Sometimes all you have to do is get out there and push the button. When there are doubts, when the haters are getting to you, when you worry that you're past prime, never going to amount to anything, that's when you've gotta go out and make pictures. Prime the pump, get those psychomotor cues going. Creating something is the best solution to get out of a funk; there are precious few things better than an unexpectedly good picture. I wasn't expecting much out of these, but I really like 'em.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Fuck I'm verbose today. Wrote my intro for the OKCITY book too. Might do a limited run(10-20), and publish a pdf for free. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;this is what happens when you double tap long exposures- more often than not one or the other will be good. for this one, the second frame was really blurry.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bluewed/0001.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;i tried this in black and white, but his eyes really make the picture. I don't think I had a good portrait of him before this either, so it's doubly good.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bluewed/0002.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was going to be titled &quot;the fight,&quot; but I don't know if it comes through.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bluewed/0003.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Another eye picture.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bluewed/0004.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>
