        <item>
          <title>Photo Walk</title>
          <description>The 4th was a good night; I ended up sort of all over the place, first riding my bike to a party right on the river in Tulsa, and then catching a ride out to the sticks for a huge bash in a field (this being the 4th, and it being oklahoma, nobody's day is complete without going out into the middle of nowhere and Blowing Shit Up). &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We get there and there's a $10 cover per head. Then we stand in line for beer for half an hour for 3.2 bud light. Then, just as I'm tweeting about how a fight would be a nice mood lifter, it starts to rain. So, the people who have tents run for them, and the people who don't run for their cars. I'm not lying when I say that I probably had a better time sitting in that car listening to music and talking than I would have getting obliterated and setting fire to the whole party. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then we bailed and headed back to Tim's apartment, where everybody just crashed. Which meant that my bike was across downtown from me when I woke up in the morning, so of course, I went to get it. I didn't &lt;span &gt;have to&lt;/span&gt; walk, I could have waited for a ride to pick it up, but the walk appealed to me. And then there were photos:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0008.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0009.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0010.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0011.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0012.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0013.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0014.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 09 Jul 2009 22:27:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/09/photo-walk/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/09/photo-walk/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>oh yeah, I was supposed to post these...</title>
          <description>Yeah, meant to put these up yesterday. Got distracted by Hulu again. &lt;span &gt;Royal Pains&lt;/span&gt; this time. Good thing House is in the off season, or I'd never get anything done. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Seriously though, I went out to Tulsa to take a break and recharge, sort of reset myself. One of the nice effects of travel is you almost always get a fresh look at yourself while trying to look at a new place, even if that new place is only a couple hours away. I'd been feeling a little blocked up creatively and a weekend away from my routine was just what I needed. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I actually fasted this weekend- not in the &quot;not eating at all&quot; sense of the word but in the &quot;staying hungry&quot; sense. One moderate meal a day, the occasional beer, maybe a snack. Whenever I've tried the cold turkey no food approach, I've failed miserably, because I lack the willpower. One meal a day is enough to give you the edge of feeling hungry without making it into this huge task. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;About that- the edge of hardship- when things are difficult, sometimes it will make you sharper, quicker, more discerning- you can rise to the situation in a way that, when everything is easy, you couldn't. I've always thought the best art comes out of working around limitations, not when the limitations are removed. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fastingweekend/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 07 Jul 2009 20:32:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/07/oh-yeah-i-was-supposed-to-post-these/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/07/oh-yeah-i-was-supposed-to-post-these/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Midnight photo sesh</title>
          <description>Couple photos... Went to sleep on Timmy &amp; Ali's couch, woke up when Ali got home after the bars, hung out with all these dudes. Tulsa=Coolsville thus far. My team won at trivia, although I don't think I contributed more than one or two answers. Bike Against hunger got some money, and some gift certificates on top of that. Today's adgenda includes a bike shop and finding whole foods.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alishouse/0001.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alishouse/0002.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alishouse/0003.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>The cookout</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pridecookout/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;After pride, there was this cookout, with a bunch of excellent food. The chef from Cafe 7, which is on the northside somewhere (chime in in the comments if you know where it is). F'ing amazing ziti, pretty good kebabs, pesto crusted grilled chicken, it was nice. Some days I forget to eat until late in the day, and then circumstance prevents it for a couple more hours, and then I'm rewarded for the wait with a meal like that. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pridecookout/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It was really nice, but I wish I had more photos of the whole thing. Like I said, I was having an off day sunday, maybe because of the lack of sustenance. I had to let the hate pass before I could even look at the photos again, that's why I took these sunday and you're just now seeing them.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pridecookout/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, I'm several days out from my last cup of coffee. I think that's what I'll go do now. That and get ready for TULSA: THE SEQUAL. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pridecookout/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 02 Jul 2009 17:51:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/02/the-cookout/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/07/02/the-cookout/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>it all sucks</title>
          <description>So I was going to post some more pictures, but I hate everything I've shot now, and so there's nothing else to post. </description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 30 Jun 2009 18:50:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/30/it-all-sucks/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/30/it-all-sucks/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Pride Parade</title>
          <description>So, it's pride 09. I wasn't on, but these I like. For those who don't know: I'm straight. And I'm not going to lie, this was mostly about being a part of the spectacle and drinking and cooking out for me. But yes, I do support a whole range of gay rights, marriage and equal protection and other things. But this was a party on wheels. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'd like to say the big fail is because of the lack of intimacy with the subject(true), or sub-standard camera equipment(not true), but really it was because I lacked two things: focus and a camera strap. I wasn't focused on taking pictures, more on riding the new bike, and I didn't have a strap to hold the camera so I was constantly death gripping it and worried I would drop it. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Two days before, but already started at the Copa.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The Bike Horde.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was something about people wearing leather and being gay? Not sure. update from my friend hope who Knows Things: &quot;The picture at the pride parade the people in leather. Its the national leather association. that's what the blue and black flag with the red heart represents. its a BDSM community with a very strong Gay following. I know i always have the strangest information. but there you go.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This really surprised me; Dell is a big company, glad to see that they were out there in support. They have a pretty big call center here in the city.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The Boneshakers were out, all five of us that are still here and riding.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I don't know what to say about the dude on the horse.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The crowd at the end was something else. A couple thousand people, easily. All along the route there were spectators, but nothing to make me expect this. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/pride09/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 30 Jun 2009 18:15:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/30/pride-parade/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/30/pride-parade/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>night portraits</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I actually took this because I really liked the light, and I wanted to remember it for future studio use. Single, harsh light can be good, even from directly above the subject.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightportraits/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Another &quot;miracle&quot; picture: there's no way to express how little light there is when one of the biggest sources in the picture is a cell phone screen. Of course, there's quite a bit coming off the streetlights too. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nightportraits/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Ok, tiny post over. The pride pictures are mostly edited, they'll be along sometime soon.</description>

        <item>
          <title>skate photos...</title>
          <description>I said at the time on twitter, that I wished for a wider lens, but really I think these aren't bad at all. A camera that can shoot sequences would be nice, and I could have shot more varied things with more lenses, but I think sometimes limitations can drive creativity, and that's what happened here.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;For everybody that's tired of Tulsa pictures and posts, don't worry, I've got one more small post and then it's back to OKC pictures. And yeah, I could have put up all these pictures at once, but would you have looked as much at them, seen them as well?         <item>
          <title>More Tulsa, With Cars!</title>
          <description>SUNDAY SUNDAY SUNDAY... was when I took these. Sunday morning, mostly, although the car show was in the afternoon. i really wasn't that impressed visually with the cars... i liked their style, I thought the work was impressive, but visually to me cars are just a big dead thing in the frame. If I'd been reporting on the car show, I would have picked out little details, but as it was I was just walking around with Rachel and Gretchen, all of us trying not to die in the heat. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;         <item>
          <title>Oh the life of a freelancer...</title>
          <description>A week ago, I went down to medicine park to assist &lt;a href =&quot;http://www.jeremycharles.com&quot;&gt;Jeremy Charles&lt;/a&gt; with a little advertorial. Hold the reflector, keep the lights from blowing away, that sort of thing. While I was there, I had a little down time to walk up the main drag and shoot a few pics of the town, and while details were being decided, I was able to shoot the little kid who was the subject of the ad in question. It was nice to get out and shoot in the mode of dropping into a location, gestalting, and shooting pictures based on those impressions. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It's also always nice to work with a pro of Jeremy's caliber, someone who knows their look, knows their gear, lights, who &quot;gets it.&quot; That said, working with a family of four who are inexperienced in front of the camera, and having two small kids in that mix, was stressful.    &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0009.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0010.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0011.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0012.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0013.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0014.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0015.jpg&quot;         <item>
          <title>Mom was in the hospital...</title>
          <description>for once, i actually managed to Shoot pictures of mom from start to finish in the hospital. This visit was more than a little silly. She had a non-specific infection, possbly blood, possibly kidney, but they made her stay in the hospital for 4 days when she could have stayed at home. Ostensibly it was to monitor her, but I don' think we would have done a worse job of that at home. Add to that the stress factor of being in the hospital, and the whole thing was kind of ridiculous. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; font-size=&quot;smaller&quot;&gt;Mom the day she went to the dialysis clinic with a fever.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0001.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; font-size=&quot;smaller&quot;&gt;The first cultures, which were the only ones that came back positive.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0002.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; font-size=&quot;smaller&quot;&gt;Hallway going into Presbyterian Tower, OU Med center. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0003.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; font-size=&quot;smaller&quot;&gt;Mom coming back from the vending machines. Not happy.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0004.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; font-size=&quot;smaller&quot;&gt;In the last few minutes of her stay, the doctor came in and removed her catheter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/lastfilm/0005.jpg&quot; class=&quot;photo&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;On the other hand, she did feel quite a bit better getting out (no more infection), and she doesn't have a cardiac catheter any more- the leg graft they did several months ago is working, and as of today, she's about halfway through training to stick herself and do the whole thing at home again.</description>

        <item>
          <title>random</title>
          <description>So I've finally gotten my film developed, and the first batch is just some random photos. There was another roll of old film I found in a drawer, and I think at least one of these is from that. It's really weird and difficult to be working with files scanned from film automatically. I can't adjust exposure or white balance or any of that good stuff. Oh well, at least they're better than nothing. I can't wait until I get a new body in though. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/film1/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/film1/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/film1/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/film1/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/film1/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>lack of posting (and why)</title>
          <description>So I've been doing stuff and seeing things, but the reason I haven't been posting that much is this:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/film.jpg&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That's almost a week's worth of shooting. I know, I know, that's not a lot, but it will make for about a week's worth of posts, once I get around to developing it. I'm waiting on some money from a lens I sold. (With my canon body out of commission, I didn't need the 24-105 any more, so it went on ebay and sold quick).&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Meanwhile, there was a race yesterday, Bike Against Hunger the First, which was pretty cool. Kudos to Ken for putting it together and for all the rad prizes. Cody won, and I'd swear he rode up to my checkpoint on one wheel. He was there and gone in about 10 seconds. Yeah though, if you ever get the chance to work a checkpoint, bring a sign and a nice chair. A beverage and a book are optional but the book probably saved my sanity, i just wished I'd had the rest of that stuff. That, and it's impossible to run a checkpoint and take pics of the checkpoint at the same time. It's one or the other. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;OK, I'm going to save the rest for another day, because there are a lot of stories to tell, and a lot of pictures that go with them, so rather than mix things all about, I'll just wait until I can get the pictures, and then tell the stories.</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 15 Jun 2009 04:52:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/15/lack-of-posting-and-why/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/15/lack-of-posting-and-why/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>people suck</title>
          <description>The comments on the story about the accident in tulsa are really terrible, really sad. I can't believe people actually think like that, that the solution to driver negligence (which is almost always the case of bike accidents involving a bike and a car) is for cyclists to not ride their bikes. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I ride a &lt;span &gt;road bike&lt;/span&gt;. I ride it on the road because it's made for pavement, and because it's illegal for me to ride on the sidewalk. For a lot of miles of my riding, there are no sidewalks. Bike trails are nice where the exist, and I don't mind dodging pedestrians and slower cyclists even, but the trails almost never go anywhere useful. I ride in the middle of the lane because that's the safest place for me to be. I am more noticeable and to pass me you have to use the other lane. I'm almost never on roads that don't have a passing lane, at least when traffic is an issue. Every cyclist with any experience knows the roads with the best pavement and least traffic to get where they are going, and new cyclists often hear about them the first time they meet other riders ('You take 10th st all the way from where? no no no, take 4th to downtown, then...').&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;If you're a driver, watch where you're going and don't drive drunk, ok? I see a lot of people bitching on the internet about aggro/self righteous cyclists, but if a random cyclist started killing drivers at random, and got away with it (hit and runs are the rule), wouldn't you be mad at them? This case would have been just like that, if an eyewitness hadn't run the driver off the road to stop her.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Fact: you have to double or triple your speed to reduce time traveled by a significant amount when driving in town. That means that even a full 60 seconds waiting behind a cyclist (this is a lot longer than you think) going 15 mph waiting to pass is only going to slow you by about 30 seconds in your overall travel time. You spend more time than that sitting at red lights, making coffee or chatting with co-workers. Hell, I spend more time staring at the wall persuading myself to get out of bed. It's not worth getting upset over and certainly not worth killing some poor guy who's just trying to get somewhere. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;If you're a cyclist, be careful. You'd look hotter in a helmet, and by hotter I mean sexier without head injuries. Use lower traffic roads, lights, and bright clothing. Of course, none of that helped me this last time, but I know it's saved me a thousand other times. Don't be an asshole, but take the lane, it's yours by law, and if you're off to the side, it's easier to go unnoticed. If a driver is coming towards you, yell at them, whatever you feel like yelling, as loud as you can. More than once yelling &quot;HEY!&quot; has saved my bacon.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I think that's all. Good luck and good night.</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 10 Jun 2009 06:16:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/10/people-suck/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/10/people-suck/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Car Kills Two Cyclists in Tulsa, third in hospital</title>
          <description>I already posted this to twitter, but I figure more people will see it if I put it here too. I look at all those bike pieces scattered in the road, and I'm thinking, if my bike had been super light carbon, that'd be me. Lugged Steel Saved My Life. (For those that don't know: I was &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/blog/2009/05/wreck.html&quot;&gt;hit a couple weeks ago&lt;/a&gt; by an inattentive driver).&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Text story &lt;a href=&quot;http://artfa.gs/driver-kills&quot;&gt;here&lt;/a&gt; and video: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;script type='text/javascript' src='http://www.newson6.com/global/video/videoplayer.js?rnd=882102;hostDomain=www.newson6.com;playerWidth=400;playerHeight=340;isShowIcon=true;clipId=3849424;playerType=POPUP_EMBEDDEDscript'&gt;&lt;/script&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;This is a sad day. My heart goes out to the dude in the hospital and the families of the dead. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;(another post to follow, more generally about sharing the road.)</description>

        <item>
          <title>photo adventures</title>
          <description>This is from the rest of the last batch of processing. Traci (last picture) came and rescued me from my stircrazyness on Friday, whereupon we went downtown and walked around, lots of fun things to see around that time of day, just as work is getting out. Then there was sauced pizza and a norman party, where everybody thought my brace was fake until I told them the story. Getting out again, I've told that same story 20 million times. hopefully I'm done telling it now, but I have a feeling I won't be able to stop until I'm done wearing the brace.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;My dad, playing with the dog. I don't know what occasioned this look. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Most people would take a picture of the statue that this camera watches, but I found the sign much more interesting.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I know I've taken and shown similar, but I don't care.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This is the inside of an old bank building, downtown. The architecture was quite detailed and decorative, very nice. the kind of stuff nobody makes any more.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Alleys:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Traci, picking her outfit. With ISO 400 film, this was like 1/30th of a second at f/1.2. The party was darker, so those pictures didn't really work out.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 01 Jun 2009 02:29:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/01/photo-adventures/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/06/01/photo-adventures/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>old photos..</title>
          <description>since I've had to resort to shooting film, I had to get it processed, and there was this random roll that has been on my printer stand for a while, so I had it done as well. These are from the end of spring 2006, at the annual Doc Studies barbecue. Looking at this old work, I couldn't help but notice how different it is, and how much higher a percentage of misses I had back then, even with the same camera &amp; lens.  &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Two of the graduating seniors.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Professors standing around. The difference in the personalities from right to left is so huge, if they stood any closer, the universe would have exploded.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Kari, my girlfriend at the time. I'm going to leave it as an exercise for the reader to make up what happened between us. I can tell you it won't be as interesting as what actually happened.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;photo&quot; src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/severalposts/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Paseo arts fest</title>
          <description>I forgot my cf cards, and so I had to improvise and use my phone camera to take a few pictures. It was a very zen experience shooting this way, with complete simplicity. I was able to concentrate soley on the images.  you only have one button to push, and that's it. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/zenessay/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I was sitting there, at sauced, at Haley's booth, and I was watching all the ametures with their digital rebels, and I realized that the difference between them and the professionals I had worked around and with was principally one of concentration. The pros are zeroed in on what they are doing, the only thing in the world for them is the viewfinder. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Matty from the Rodchenko(sp?) angle. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/zenessay/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;On a completely different note, I found a really cool company called Elphel building the open source camera I dreamed up last year. they sell a bunch of boards that could theoretically turn any old 35mm film camera into a digital camera, in either black and white or color. Their examples kinda suck, and I suspect it has something to do with the tone curves they're using, but if I can get the parts and get it to spit out 16 bit raw data, I would be one happy matt mills. For the nerds: &lt;a href=&quot;http://www3.elphel.com/&quot;&gt;Elphel's web site&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/zenessay/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/zenessay/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/zenessay/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 26 May 2009 08:16:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/26/paseo-arts-fest/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/26/paseo-arts-fest/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>it's 6:30 and I'm still up. time to give up on sleep?</title>
          <description>(note: where I say today, I'm mostly talking about sunday, as I started writing this at about 5am monday morning, thinking still as if &quot;today&quot; were sunday. It's a total brain dump/rant, but there's a lot of good tidbits, anyway).&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I can't sleep. Maybe if I write everything down that's on my mind, I can get some peace and rest. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The lawyer situation: I've made the initial contact with someone who is supposed to be good, but may or may not know anything about bikes/bike law. I sent along the police report, descriptions of my injuries and the photo of the bike I put on twitter. So, on that, I'm waiting. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Injuries: everything was better today, except for right after I woke up; moving around a little worked out the little bit of stiffness that I had, and the only thing that's bothered me all day has been my ankle, and that only in the last couple hours. For some reason, bad days seem to follow the good ones, and I'm more than a little afraid of waking up in agony. Maybe that's why I can't sleep. No pain pills today though, that's something. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;On the subject of pain pills, I'm somewhat divided, because on the one hand, they allow me to function on the bad days, at the worst moments, I can still get out of bed and move about the house, but I'm always a little hazy on those days, and it's nice to be clear. Would I just be in bed, suffering? Does pain by itself slow healing? When will I stop feeling like I've been hit by a car at 35mph?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Questions for the doctor (appointment on the second): How long will it take me to recover? How much of a recovery can I expect to make? Am I permanently damaged? When can I get rid of the shell? Where is the break exactly? Can I see my X-rays? How much PT (physical therapy) will I need? &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Questions for the lawyer: How hard is this going to be? Is all of my stuff (bike, camera) covered? How much PT will I be able to afford? What about lost work time/income? &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I've got lists of things that I need and/or want; things that are missing, notably my passport and notebook and flask; lists that I don't know if I'll ever tick off all the items or not. How is it that despite being an invalid unable to drive or walk I have so much to accomplish? And the number of little side things on my mind, besides. For example: I have to get my car registered and licensed this week, and I'm thinking about either getting an iphone or fixing the netbook, but I don't really know which to do, and I can't do anything at all about these things till friday, which is when I get my last paycheck from OSU. The paycheck is a surprise, though. I'm glad for it, and that I'll be able to fix/do stuff once I get it. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then there's all the nice stuff people have done for me, from loaning books to bringing me beer to just coming over and hanging out and talking. I have a stack of comic books that I've read thanks to Cyrus and a bunch of DVDs that I've half watched on the nod, thanks to Adam M. I had the best cup of coffee I've ever tasted while I was still in the hospital thanks to Francois. I've got beer and good literature thanks to Stuart. I'm just now digging into the lit. Ken got me a freakin' camera, even if it is just on loan for a while. That's why there's still a trickle of pictures up here. I haven't forgotten any of you, and I'm trying to think of something nice to do, in gratitude, once I'm back on my feet.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That's about it. I think I've gone from the surface to the deep parts of what's on my mind. If I wrote any more, I'd be telling my life story, as all the other thoughts I have are just snippets of anecdotes from disconnected stories.</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 25 May 2009 11:32:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/25/it-s-6-30-and-i-m-still-up-time-to-give-up-on-sleep/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/25/it-s-6-30-and-i-m-still-up-time-to-give-up-on-sleep/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>sam's club and the electric cart</title>
          <description>I've never before actually needed to ride in one, but they say there's a first for everything. Today, I used one of those electric carts to get around sams. FYI, they're a pain when you have to use them. That and for some reason I kept getting dirty looks; I guess because I have the brace on under my shirt people thought I was a healthy person abusing the cart, if that were possible. Oh well. Photos:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;For memorial day, or whatever holiday this is. Yay flag.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/electriccart/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Bathroom sign at old chicago.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/electriccart/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;And finally some rain.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/electriccart/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

          <title>Wednesday Cripple</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedcripple/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedcripple/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedcripple/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/wedcripple/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Out of the house</title>
          <description>Went out last night. Did the whole blue note/ladies night thing. Tommy G came and picked me up, and off we went, into the night. It was nice to see some of the people out that I hadn't seen in two weeks. Of course, as sure as the night before, the morning after is a bitch. I woke up and I couldn't move, there was a lot of pain. I'm sure it was a combination of attempting to detox and the night out, but still, I'm glad the pain pills were within arms reach. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, as things stand, I still need to get a lawyer, I don't know if there's going to be long term damage, and I still don't have a job. Sometimes I need the pain pills and sometimes I don't. it seems to depend on what I've been doing more than anything; the easier I take it, the better off I am. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;On the good news list, I have a camera now, thanks to Ken's boss. It's a digi Rebel, nothing to write home about, but it's functional, at least, and I figure I could do worse. It's not like I have any assignments anyway. Project idea: Photograph all the stuff people have loaned/given me while convalescing. I might work on that after my nap. photos of last night to follow later too.</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 21 May 2009 17:01:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/21/out-of-the-house/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/21/out-of-the-house/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>fallout</title>
          <description>I write this blog for two reasons, to share pictures and so all the people in my life, no matter how far flung, can get an idea of what's going on in my life. Now, since I had the wreck last tuesday, I've only posted once, just putting up some details and leaving it at that. Since then I've been popping pain pills at regular intervals and working my way through the stack of comic books and movies my friends brought by. Then someone bitches in the comments that I'm boring him. I told him to go fuck himself, because, hey, I deserve a couple days off for the broken back. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;On the other hand, I do have a few updates to pass along. I got out of the hospital Friday, and promptly took a nap. When I woke up I realized I hadn't looked at my camera in several days, so I pulled it out and found it was broken. My 50mm 1.2 won't autofocus and the mode dial no longer works at all. And the battery door is broken off. The bag I was carrying has a hole in it, too.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It's hard to get up and down, but I can walk and stand pretty well, although that does depend on me keeping up with the pain pills- one every four hours and I can move and function pretty well. On the pain meds, I can do most normal stuff.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I didn't take any before I went to sleep last night, mostly because I was feeling fine and I really don't like the drugged feeling. This morning, I was regretting that decision, because all of the minor aches had turned to major ones, and it was a task just to sit up in bed. I took pills, and now I'm fine. I can't wait for the day when I don't depend on pills to get around the house. Should be soon.</description>
          <pubDate>Sun, 17 May 2009 14:54:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/17/fallout/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/17/fallout/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>the wreck</title>
          <description>since I've told this about twenty times yesterday and today, and a lot of those tellings were under the influence of strong drugs, i figure one more time won't hurt.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;i was riding my bike into town on 4th street and a car &lt;span &gt;t-boned me&lt;/span&gt; hit me from the rear. The lady said she was singing to her kids. my lights were on, and i'd bet they weren't looking. I can't remember any of what happened. paramedics said the car was pretty messed up, but they also noticed I had my lights on. at least the car didn't run off. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;they took me to ou med center, where they determined I have a spinal fracture but no damage to my spinal cord. bruised ribs, some cuts, and my right ankle is stiff. I'm alive and I'll heal, which is the good news. i'm going to be laid up for a while though, have to wear a torso brace for 6 weeks. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;everybody's been awesome, thanks for all the support, food, books, and just dropping in to visit. I'm here till tomorrow at least, then home and more rest. pills. no bike for a while. if you want to get in touch but don't have my number, just send me a direct message on twitter. laters.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;(Edit to fix how the accident happened, I was more bruised on one side than the other, making me think I was t-boned).</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 14 May 2009 16:50:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/14/the-wreck/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/14/the-wreck/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>another wreck</title>
          <description>since I've told this about twenty times today, and a lot of those tellings were under the influence of strong drugs, i figure one more time won't hurt.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;i was riding into town on 4th street and a car t-boned me. my lights were on, and i'd bet money they weren't looking. paramedics said the car was pretty messed up too.</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 14 May 2009 05:54:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/14/another-wreck/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/14/another-wreck/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Finally, I know where the flats are coming from</title>
          <description>Or at least some of them. It's a bad idea to leave your bike in a hot car- heat raises pressure and softens rubber, and then before you know it, you've had 10 flats in just a few weeks. And it's always a bummer to go out to get your wheels for a ride and find flats. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Last night was a typical monday- blue note pool, tommy g night ride, but with a couple bonuses. Ran into some people who told me rumors of photo work, so that's pretty awesome. Also: Alibi's, which I'd never been to before last night, has $3 bottomless cups of beer. It's shitty light beer, but it will make drunkface just fine. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Meet Tasha. Cool chick. I fixed her bike a little. And by fixed her bike, you know what I mean. Flat tire, of course.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alibiride/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, after some drinking, it was time to ride and work off the beer. We got about a mile, and then I had a blowout. My guess is my rim strip already had a hole from the first blowout of the night, which happened in my car before the evening started. So, I had to sit around and wait for some one to go grab my car, and then we made a walmart run for more tubes, and then the ride was back on. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;self, tasha. Tommy needs his own camera, he's got a good eye.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alibiride/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;By the time we were actually riding, it was 3:30am. We did a couple parking garages, a little bricktown, I skidded the ramp in front of the theater (it's a really long ass ramp, ~100 yards), and the freewheel riding dudes (tommy and lem) I was with didn't care. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&quot;Wouldn't it be cool to climb that fire escape,&quot; Tommy said. &quot;Except for the fall and die part,&quot; I said.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alibiride/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Lem&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alibiride/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Tommy&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/alibiride/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 12 May 2009 19:37:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/12/finally-i-know-where-the-flats-are-coming-from/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/12/finally-i-know-where-the-flats-are-coming-from/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Water Boarding Party</title>
          <description>remember when I said I was bored with taking pictures of drunk people? somebody heard that and responded with the wildest, craziest thing I've ever seen at a party. They had a water boarding party. In priest robes.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/waterboard/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;They swore up and down that they'd gotten them legally. The robes. And as for the water torture, well, what's a little torture between friends?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/waterboard/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Actually, everyone pouring got poured on too, so it was at least sort of fair. And there was a &quot;safe word,&quot; in the form of a hammer that the person on the board would drop when they'd had enough. Which was usually seconds. Nobody made it very long.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/waterboard/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Right now, you're thinking to yourself, &quot;Did MM get waterboarded?&quot; and the answer is a definite no. I drowned &lt;a href=&quot;http://payingoffmyloans.blogspot.com/2008/01/nine-times-ive-nearly-died-pt-1.html&quot;&gt;once before&lt;/a&gt; (note, the near-death count has gone up since then), was resuscitated, and for about six years of my childhood I didn't go near the water, and I took very shallow baths. So, I don't need to experience simulated drowning, I've had the real thing.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/waterboard/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Other than the torture, it was a pretty standard evening, with a lot of beer and liquor consumed, and crashing out on the couch. I hadn't been letting myself get that drunk, but once in a while it's fun. At least I didn't black out.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/waterboard/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;         <item>
          <title>felt like saturday all night...</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Band plays art opening. Man bites dog.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/feelslikesat/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So yesterday was really crazy. For a dude like me, who doesn't have normal, that means it was extra special. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;A little taste of ISO 25,000. THIS IS HOW REAL MEN TAKE PICTURES.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/feelslikesat/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;(edit out long drawn out account of room cleaning, wheel building, and finally bike tube acquisition, which was crazy to do, but after writing it out, boring to tell). &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;These two old dudes were just sitting togetther mooning over each other in a loud bar filled with people a third their age. Aww.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/feelslikesat/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then there was booze cruise and Sauced and Hi lo, and hanging out at Erin/Colby's place, with some random Cmay thrown in just because my night wasn't interesting enough already. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;People always do this. Not usually in triplicate, though.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/feelslikesat/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;On a random somewhat tangentially related note (but who wants boring details?) I realized last night that I like philosophies that allow me to do nothing and reap benefits for it. That's all. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Bike ride? Bike ride.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/feelslikesat/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>kamps</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toomuchkamps/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toomuchkamps/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toomuchkamps/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toomuchkamps/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 07 May 2009 08:27:00 GMT</pubDate>

          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/07/kamps/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>I hate grading</title>
          <description>You know that story about how some monasteries require applicants to stand outside and wait for three days before they can enter? After a semester of teaching a bunch of kids who are just there to fill in a blank on their degree rubric, I understand that now. So many people aren't in college to learn, they're there to buy a piece of paper. And when you expect them to do more than sit there in class and stare at the wall, they balk. Sometimes there's one or two good students, but they're the exception. It would be nice if we could limit our students to those who wanted to learn. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Dinner on no diet day. Gotta love it.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/grill.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Oh well. I'll never be an ancient sage of anything, either, and I'm not taking another teaching job, unless it's teaching photography as art. I'll never forget the blank faces I got after showing my students &quot;La Jetee.&quot; It wasn't that they didn't understand the film, they had just ignored it. Anyway, the sun is shining, the outside is gorgeous, and I'm off.</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 07 May 2009 00:17:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/07/i-hate-grading/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/07/i-hate-grading/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>stoking my paranoia</title>
          <description>from &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2009/05/an_expectation.html&quot;&gt;Schneier&lt;/a&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;blockquote&gt;... Twenty years ago, if someone wanted to look through your correspondence, he had to break into your house. Now, he can just break into your ISP. Ten years ago, your voicemail was on an answering machine in your office; now it's on a computer owned by a telephone company. Your financial accounts are on remote websites protected only by passwords; your credit history is collected, stored, and sold by companies you don't even know exist.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And more data is being generated. Lists of books you buy, as well as the books you look at, are stored in the computers of online booksellers. Your affinity card tells your supermarket what foods you like. What were cash transactions are now credit card transactions. What used to be an anonymous coin tossed into a toll booth is now an EZ Pass record of which highway you were on, and when. What used to be a face-to-face chat is now an e-mail, IM, or SMS conversation -- or maybe a conversation inside Facebook.&lt;/blockquote&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 05 May 2009 20:02:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/05/stoking-my-paranoia/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/05/stoking-my-paranoia/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Just to prove that I don't just shoot parties...</title>
          <description>I took my camera to the grocery store. I have an idea: to make interesting pictures when nothing is happening. It's a weird personal barrier I have, a switch that is either on or off in my head; if it doesn't seem to me like anything is happening, then nothing is. Of course, something is always happening, &quot;the earth is always shifting, the light is always changing, the sea does not cease to grind down rock.&quot; (james baldwin) &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/crestmonday/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/crestmonday/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/crestmonday/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/crestmonday/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/crestmonday/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 04 May 2009 21:18:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/04/just-to-prove-that-i-don-t-just-shoot-parties/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/04/just-to-prove-that-i-don-t-just-shoot-parties/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>And then came saturday...</title>
          <description>I spent a lot of last week in bed, although not in a good way. I was laid low by some upper respiratory virus, most likely a cold, but maybe the flu. No swollen glands or soreness, though, and no high fever, so probably not. Wednesday I was fine, Thursday I woke up and had a sore throat and slept all day and then felt fine, Friday I felt like shit all day so I stayed in and out of the rain, and then came Saturday. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/melissasgoingaway/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Saturday, I was supposed to meet up with a certain lady to hang out. So I text her  around 6:30, she says she's still at work, so I tell her to just let me know when she gets free, and we can coordinate then. 10:30 rolls around, no news, so I decide to head out on my own. I still haven't heard back from her. Can't win 'em all. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/melissasgoingaway/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I went to Sauced for a few good beers and then Blue note for a few less good beers, and then Cyrus texts me and says he's at a party around the corner. So I say I'll be there in a hot minute and head out. Side note: Paying in cash means you can leave whenever you want to. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/melissasgoingaway/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So I get to the party and no Cyrus. There were a bunch of people I didn't know and one that I did; it was Melissa's going away party. So, I turned my gregariousness up to 11 and met a bunch of new people, although I'm afraid by that time I was more fueled by booze than by social graces. Then there was more beer and more hard liquor and a lot of blurry moments. Cyrus got back maybe 15 minutes after I'd arrived, with more beer. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/melissasgoingaway/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Later, after more beer and some whiskey, I extracted myself from the party, wandered around a bit, decided I should park the car, got on my bike, wandered a bit more and ended up crashing on Cyrus' couch. I realized this morning that that particular party was the kind where you have a really good time while there and then only later realize you were making a complete fool out of yourself. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/melissasgoingaway/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Today was a typical sunday: Jeff's for brunch, video games, movies, pizza, bar, home. I've got to get a job, and an apartment, and a motorcycle. In that order. Ah, goals. It's nice to have those again.</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 04 May 2009 08:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/04/and-then-came-saturday/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/04/and-then-came-saturday/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Hiatus</title>
          <description>Sorry for the hiatus. I've been stupid and self-doubting or maybe smart and self doubting. And I've been sick. Anyway, while my hard drive is restoring from backup, I thought I'd share a few of the week's lesser failures. Actually, looking at the pix, they're not that bad. Lighting in clubs is just impossible unless you bring your own. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/kampswed/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I shot these all last wednesday, at Kamp's deli. It turns into the latest and greatest OKC dance club on wednesday nights. It might be there more often, but I really don't know. It was actually really fun, there was a good spread of music and a good spread of people. Lots of photographers, although I was the only one not using flash. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/kampswed/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'm not leaving out the captions out of laziness or unremembered details, but I really think these don't need anything to explain them.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/kampswed/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/kampswed/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/kampswed/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 04 May 2009 07:32:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/04/hiatus/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/05/04/hiatus/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>because I'm a sucker for a pretty lady</title>
          <description>and because it's her birthday, and because, well, what are friends for? I'm posting yet another huge batch of photos to flickr. This time though, I'm going to be smart and only post highlights here and if you want to see the whole set you can head over there &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.flickr.com/photos/photomattmills/sets/72157617411519820/show/&quot;&gt;by clicking this finely crafted link&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Sometimes I find that I know I have enough good pictures of something and yet I'm still shooting, something is knawing at me to keep going, and I don't really know why. On an &quot;on&quot; night, this means I come away with quite a lot of good stuff. This shoot was about 5% that I liked, and maybe as high as 20% that weren't crap, even by my standards. In a small party, that means a lot of pictures of the same people, and yet some people get missed, too. Sorry if I missed you. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rachelsparty/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rachelsparty/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rachelsparty/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rachelsparty/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rachelsparty/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rachelsparty/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/rachelsparty/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;         <item>
          <title>Norman Music Fest</title>
          <description>This is the 200th post here, and to celebrate, I'm being lazy and trying flickr's embedded slideshows. These are all from norman music fest, taken yesterday.         <item>
          <title>Clearing off the card...</title>
          <description>In anticipation of a monster weekend (Norman music fest tomorrow, arts fest tonight if I can get my ass in gear), I had to clear off the card in the camera, and because I love you all so much, I'm sharing. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;No matter what I do to this tree in Lightroom, it's still just a tree. I still kinda like it though.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/morecaptions/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Polo.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/morecaptions/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Cookout after polo. seriously good burgers and salsa at the Murray's house. (sorry if I just butchered your name, Adam)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/morecaptions/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Trying to get together a mutant stretched bike. Don't know if they succeeded, I left for the Blue note.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/morecaptions/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Hipshot, this girl was in her own world, literally dancing to a beat only she could hear. Which is too silly, because if the music had gone with what she was dancing, she wouldn't have been half bad.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/morecaptions/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Plan</title>
          <description>plan for the day:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;1. Drink Coffee&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;2. Take mom to work&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;3. Shoot Pictures&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;4. Pick Mom up From Work&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;5. Come home&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;6. Blog&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;7. Drink/Philander/fall down/sleep as needed</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 22 Apr 2009 10:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/22/plan/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/22/plan/</link>

        <item>
          <title>23rd street</title>
          <description>So I finally got out and shot some yesterday, for the first time in three or four days. I don't know what exactly caused the slump; I've been doing a lot around the house, just sort of hanging out with friends, nothing terribly interesting. So I decided to do something with myself. Calling around to find someone to model failed, everyrone was either recovering from the weekend or not answering their phones.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, no pretty ladies in these pictures. I had the crazy idea to go way out on 23rd street yesterday, and along the way I was sort of pulled in by all the signs I saw. I'm going to have to go back and shoot some more out there; might do a photo-walk of the few miles between choctaw and post road. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This victorian house was out in the middle of a lot of mobile homes for sale; it looked more like a storage for unwanted uprooted homes than a sales lot.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I shot this mostly for the patch of light and the clouds. These tonalities are really difficult to get right on a screen.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Like I said, signs.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This last one was taken of the wig shop, much later at night. It's a really strange looking place. I have to remember to try to go in there when they're open.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sunday23rdst/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>This post is all captions</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Went to the bike art opening, a lot of Norman scenesters and young parents in the crowd. The art was ok, the bikes were cool.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;This was the coolest part: the fixed-gear as objet d'art. That and chris' paintings; my only criticism is I wish they were bigger.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;This was supposed to be a bike theremin, but it was about 3/4 fail.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;The jumps they were doing were pretty cool though.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;This is Amanda. The next five pix are another unintentional photo essay. I was basically hanging out with her the whole night, although the background kept changing and some people came and went. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;For example: After we left Norman, we went to Estrella and MJ's place. Very cool casa. I'm guessing this was some kind of decorative place setting.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Does this really need explanation? Seriously.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Outside the blue note. She says to me &quot;You have your camera?&quot; I say, &quot;Of course,&quot; and she runs and jumps and lays down on the sign.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;I know I promised five pictures, and that's because there's a story with this one. This was the hostess at a pary we headed to after the blue note. Shortly after this was taken, this girl grabs Amanda by the hair and won't let go, all for a jello shot cup thrown on the floor. We had a good laugh about that in the car, leaving. Then Reghan (who'd joined us for the blue note and after) shouts out of the window &quot;We know where you live!&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;This is a true rocker. Notice that Caitlin's entire body is in motion, &lt;span &gt;except for the beer.&lt;/span&gt; Epic. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&quot;Take one for the dudes of america,&quot; he said. So I did.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/fukidol/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Sat, 11 Apr 2009 16:29:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/11/this-post-is-all-captions/</guid>
