        <item>
          <title>(insert clever title, I'm not feeling it right now)</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bestbuydumpsternight/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Last night was... interesting. I made a little trip to norman, basically to fix a light for some friends. They couldn't get the globe back on. It was actually on of those &quot;any excuse to get out of the house is a good one&quot; trips. Heading down there, the traffic was epic, and then my exit was closed, so I got lost, and it ended up taking me 45 minutes for a 20 minute trip. typical. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bestbuydumpsternight/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;For all that effort though, I was rewarded. Tracy (my friend with the broken light, remember?) made two pizzas. There would be pictures of them, but I was busy eating it. Delicious. Then I got introduced to &quot;it's always sunny in philadelphia&quot; which is a combination of awesome and strange and disturbing. the night then proceeded to get better. I took this photo on the way out:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bestbuydumpsternight/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then I went to the blue note, where there was much pool playing and a little drinking. Ran into Tommy G and Josh, and it was actually mostly dry, so we went riding. Couple parking garages scaled, a ride to best buy where we discovered that their trash was sealed. Exhaustion. Home. bed. That's about it.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Tommy g with the evil look of the day.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bestbuydumpsternight/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;me, taken by dude who's name I can't remember.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bestbuydumpsternight/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;No name dude, by me. If you're reading this, sorry dude. I forget names really easily.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bestbuydumpsternight/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 10 Apr 2009 04:17:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/10/insert-clever-title-i-m-not-feeling-it-right-now/</guid>

        <item>
          <title>really dig this.</title>
          <description>&lt;a href=&quot;http://www.counterpunch.org/goekler03242009.html&quot;&gt;The most dangerous person in the world.&lt;/a&gt; You, you scary motherfucker. Quote:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;blockquote&gt;Security itself is an illusion. It is a perception that exists only between our ears. No army, insurance policy, hazmat team, video surveillance or explosive sniffer can protect us from our own immune system, a well-intentioned but clumsy surgeon, failing to look before crossing the street, an asteroid randomly hurtling through space or someone willing to die in order to do others harm.&lt;/blockquote&gt;</description>

          <pubDate>Mon, 06 Apr 2009 06:38:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/06/for-sale-ignore-this-unless-you-re-interested/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/06/for-sale-ignore-this-unless-you-re-interested/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Time for a new bag</title>
          <description>This is one of those &quot;the shit in my bag&quot; posts, sort of. &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/blog/2008/04/things-i-carry.html&quot;&gt;Way back when&lt;/a&gt;, I didn't carry that much, life was simple, and if there was anything I needed but didn't have, I could usually just do without it.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Things are more complicated for me now. I often find myself away from home for a couple days at a time, so the stuff I carry has ballooned a bit. For the last several months I've been using a &quot;Metropolis&quot; chrome bag (I've had the bag for years, actually, but I prefer smaller bags when I can get away with them). The problem with the bag, and shoulder bags in general, is that they're very picky about how they're packed- if things are arranged wrong, something's always digging into your back, and if they're full, they stick out and fit weird. Maybe I'm doing it wrong, but it seems to me that when you've got a lot of gear, a backpack is the way to haul it.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And actually, the chrome bag is the perfect size for the hardware I carry- my cameras, my laptop, the cords and chargers, etc. But if I need anything more, say a jacket, an extra layer of clothing, and/or a water bottle, then there's just not enough room to wear it comfortably. This was brought home rather painfully this morning trying to bike in a t-shirt with a wind chill of 30Ã‹Å¡F. I made it from 23rd and robinson to 10th and broadway- about a mile, give or take some meandering and alleys. I could tell that trying to ride the rest of the way home from there would be a bad idea- a frozen matt mills can't ride his bike or take pictures or philander or any of the fun stuff. Beyond that, dying of exposure in the city with a charged cell phone is stupid. So I called my dad, and he came and picked me up.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;I'm too lazy to make a list, and this photo is short my flask and some tools I can't seem to find, but this is everything else.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/stuff.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'm a chronic couch surfer, a product of living in the burbs and partying in the city. That and all my friends live in the city. The best solution would be to move, and as soon as I have a job that lasts more than two weeks, I'm going to do that. (Remember: I'm available to photograph anything but weddings, even on short notice). For now though, I'm switching bags. Sorry Chrome, you're cool and all, but it's time to go back to my roots, a nice big backpack I've had for like 10 years. Stuffed very full, it'll hold everything I need for a week of hard travel- say, everything I'd encounter between here and timbuktu. As it is, I can put everything I need for a weekend of night parties and morning blogging. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The bag all loaded. Not too huge.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/bag.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Sun, 05 Apr 2009 20:08:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/05/time-for-a-new-bag/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/05/time-for-a-new-bag/</link>
        </item>

So photos.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;I know this is from last night, and you know where to file complaints. With some beer.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nothinking/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Polo break.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nothinking/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Sparks run? what's wrong with this picture? &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nothinking/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nothinking/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Grant plays with his new camera.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nothinking/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Erin:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nothinking/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/nothinking/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Awake and working after the party</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Mesta park, rolling around, version 1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Mornings like this one are why I started carrying my laptop in the first place. everyone else is fast asleep, but I'm up, can't sleep, and so it works out that I should be here, typing. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Yesterday was one hell of a day. I got up and made myself the perfect cup of coffee, Siracha coffee beans in the french press. Then I had another cup, the bottom of the pot, while I caught up on newsfeeds and twitter and all that. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;And then this is version 2.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;While I was chatting with Grant, I had a brilliant idea: convert my used cd's into a radio scanner. What use is a scanner, you say? Information about what is going on. News as it happens. Things to take photos of. This particular conversion was by way of the used record store, so I grabbed all the ones that were worth anything, and started to head that direction.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I got as far as my car, which I discovered was dead, and so I tried to start my other car (a mostly-broken mercury sable) and found that it too was dead. So I went back in the house, got my bike, and headed to the record store. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I get to the shop, tell the lady I'm selling if she's buying, and she takes my stack of cd's to examine them and make me an offer.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&quot;$55?&quot; the woman behind the counter offers, rejecting one. &quot;Sure,&quot; I reply- it doesn't seem like enough, but I'm hoping to hit up a pawn shop and get lucky. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So the first pawn shop I go to, I have to explain that no, a scanner isn't the same as a CB. They don't have anything. I'm ready to give up on the day at this point, but as my path took me down reno towards downtown, I passed another pawn shop, and stopped in to see. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;This was one of those slightly sketchy places, the kind that sells more guns and ammo than anything. That, and they have a large selection of used tools. I asked one of the guys behind the counter, did they have any scanners? He allows that they do, right this way. He one pulls down from a shelf which is mostly pistol ammo, a handheld that seems perfect. I turn it over and see the price: $69.99. He's gone off to ring up someone else, so I fiddle with it a bit, find out that it covers a ton of spectrum,and then when I get his attention, I ask him if he'll take 50 for it. He says yes, 50 plus tax, and so I say sold. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was pretty much the entire crowd the whole time I was at Uptown.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;From there, I go to fourth street and ride into the city. Beatnix for lunch, and they really do have the best hot roast beef in town. If only they'd get sourdough bread, it'd be perfect. I sat there after my sandwich was finished, and programmed in all the frequencies that the public services us here in the city- something like 35 channels in all. Then I have business to do. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The saga of the missing pictures continued with yours truly going to sauced and finding them still down, but Matty promised they'd be up by five, and that they were just moving things around, etc, etc. Which reminds me, I've gotta go back by there today and see what they put up, how it was done, and really if anything got done at all. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I killed about two hours then, playing with my new radio in the park. The thing I've heard on that thing already are hilarious and interesting and I think it might work out to be a good thing.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Dinner with Grant, Damaris, Timmy, Kolby, Erin, and this girl from Tulsa, can't think of her name, it might come to me later. Indian food, way out on 23rd street, really good, really filling. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Random dude. Every party needs at least one to liven things up.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then it was time to go to the dance party, only there wasn't much dancing or partying going on at uptown united. For most of the time I was there, there were more people chilling outside than inside dancing. And I do mean chilling. It got chilly for this correspondent; I was only wearing a t-shirt, though. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Timmy, passin' out.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;After waiting an hour and drinking all of my beer, The party still wasn't really going, So I left, back to rendezvous with Timmy and some of the rest of the gang; we met at Grant's, and then went from there to the former bike cave, where there was much drinking and cards and dice, and pizza and passing out also. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was the pizza part of the evening.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The dog even got some.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/scannerday/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;There. That was my friday. Now I'm going to try to pass out for a little while.</description>
          <pubDate>Sat, 04 Apr 2009 12:44:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/04/04/awake-and-working-after-the-party/</guid>

I was just a little off the whole night (actually, for the last several nights) and  I can't put my finger on why, exactly.         <item>
          <title>Midnight bike rides part eleventy-million</title>
          <description>Tuesday, I went out for a bike ride, just to get a little air, and ended up at the blue note, which has become my bar of first resort. I actually made really good time on the ride in, at least for me: 7 miles in half an hour. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;When I got there, Chris was sitting at the bar (hi chris). Next thing I know, I'm doing an irish car bomb with him and Victoria, and the night rolls out from there.  A couple beers and a couple shots later, we head back to Chris' house. On the way, I confirmed what I'd heard earlier in the day: my work had all been taken down from Sauced. It's gone, and I'm pissed. Fuck Sauced. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Eyeing a bolt-hole to attach the chain guard. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/somethingwrong/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, we got to Chris' house, which he shares with KW, and I watched Lisa put the finishing touches on her bike. It's a cute girl cruiser, fashionable and functional. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The bike. Yes, I know it'a a little blurry, so was I.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/somethingwrong/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then I rode my ass home, no idea how long it took, but it was a pretty nice ride, except for the south wind. I always pass by this last scene, but for some reason early on April Fool's day, it grabbed me. Who cares if I look foolish? Nobody was around, anyway. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/somethingwrong/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

          <description>I'm sure there will eventually be a part two to this, but my stomach started disagreeing with me, and is only now, a day and a half later, finally settling down.         <item>
          <title>ok, some pictures already</title>
          <description>It was a nice uneventful weekend... well, things happened, but it was fun and nobody got hurt this time, which is to say no fights, trips to the hospital, supergluing of wounds, etc. So all of the things that have defined my weekends of partying didn't happen. Just drinking, followed by sobering up in some chill spot (thanks to the bike cave and the schofield house, respectively, for their hospitality). Anyway, photos:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Matty at HiLo- yes, that's a plastic tiara on his head.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/notalot/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Tanner, at the bike cave, concentrating on some Texas hold 'em. I passed out like a narcoleptic on valium.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/notalot/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Andria, while she was getting me shitfaced on sunday afternoon. Jager is still a good time though.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/notalot/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Bartender, chatting. This was moments after she was showing off her tongue's lack of connective tissue. I like this picture better though.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/notalot/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Trinity and her beau, forgotten his name. She was saying something about me taking pictures at monster's ball. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/notalot/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Rainstorms, tonight. Hope tomorrow is nice, I've got work to do.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/notalot/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'll only add to these that three times in the past five days women have offered to pose scantily/provocatively clad for me. I'm not a skeezy dude, they asked me, but it's kinda funny. What change in my complete lack of game caused all this? More as it develops. (oh yeah, and bike polo post soon).</description>

        <item>
          <title>Always remember the super glue</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, tonight, during the course of bike polo, and well before I'd arrived, Timmy wacked the back of his head against a concrete pillar. Whe I first saw it, I thought it wasn't that bad, but after a second look, I realized the wound, while small, was all the way through the skin and really needed some kind of closure. I jokingly said I could stitch it up if we could find a needle and thread. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Now, I do have some pretty good first aid training and experience under my belt, so when Timmy actually wanted me to stitch it up, I thought, ok, no problem, told him it would hurt, but we could do it. So we all went back to grant's house, and we got out a needle and thread, I sterilized it in bleach, and we waited for grant to get back from the store with some peroxide to clean out the wound. Before you even think it, yes, I know that peroxide robs the tissue of oxygen, but iodine is harder to get in the middle of the night. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We all go into the dining room and I lay down a towel and pour in the disinfectant. It's a little cut, but it really needed like two stitches to close it and keep out infection. It wasn't going to close on its own. So, I stick the needle in. It goes through with a little pushing, and then refuses to come out the other side. So I pull it out, bend the needle some more, and try again. Still no joy; the point is just too dull.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We talk about taking him to a doc-in-a-box clinic, and Grant is looking up phone numbers when somebody brings up the possibility of super glue. I don't remember who, but I'm still kicking myself for not thinking of it before I tried to stitch him up. It's perfect for little out of the way wounds that need to be closed but can't be sutured for whatever reason (lack of insurance and sharp needles this time). So, Grant goes to the store again, gets some super glue, and the cut is fixed up better than the ER would have done in about five seconds.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Moral of the story: Don't forget the super glue.</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 27 Mar 2009 07:42:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/27/always-remember-the-super-glue/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/27/always-remember-the-super-glue/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Bike polo</title>
          <description>Bike polo is fun. Evidence:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 27 Mar 2009 07:40:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/27/bike-polo/</guid>

        <item>
          <title>Start with ladies' night</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;&quot;I have something in my nose? What?&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, It's very early on friday morning, and I have about three posts in the queue. They're all vaguely about drinking, and/or bikes, and or insightful important need-to-know information. Those are the only types of posts I do, so we'll see if I can do them all in one feel swoop.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Sigrid was there, writing on people's knuckles.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Wednesday was the famous and ever popular ladies night at The Blue Note, and really it was a nice time. I walked in and there was Cyrus, chillin' at the bar with a new 'dew. I actually like the new hair better, even though it is a little funny to see Cyrus in a crew cut. I laughed, I admit it.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;For example: Reaghan.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We were the two drunks at the end of the bar solving the world's problems. We came to the conclusion that people are better taken individually than in groups- there's some context missing, but that's what I remembered hung over this morning. That and a lot of pretty girls. Which brings me to the next part of the story. (You people reading this should realize that this narrative has a pretty good basis in fact, but I'm glossing over the boring parts of the evening).&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Then Cyrus upstaged all this knuckle writing by doing his whole forearm.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;New girl comes over, Jordan, we meet, get to talking, and it turns out she wants to be a Suicide Girl, but needs a photographer. I was, of course, doing my normal thing, taking drunkpictures at the bar, and so she asked me if I would do it, and me being an idiot, a sucker for a pretty lady, I said sure. So it's me and Cyrus and her hanging out and drinking, and one thing leads to another, and they're kind of talking, and then I look over and they're making out. Making out pictures don't do anything for me, but I snap a few anyway, because the impulse to document is still there.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Like I said, making out pictures don't do anything for me, but I love her surprised smile in this picture.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So I turn to Rachel, who was sitting at out table, and say something, chit chat like, and then Jordan says &quot;Matt!&quot; and pulls up her shirt. Reflexes and impulses being what they are, I snapped a couple frames. Demand all you want, but I'm not going to post that on the internet unless she tells me to, which is unlikely.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Does this look like a girl who would flash the camera for fun and profit? I like it, either way.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;From there, the night is a blur of the HiLo and then to Reaghan's new abode, where there was this somewhat interesting other girl, but then everybody passed out pretty quick, and nothing happened. Her name was Kat, I'm pretty sure, and I remember her asking about my camera earlier in the night. Maybe I'll run into her again. If not, it's the bus theory of meeting women. I'll let you work that one out while I'm working on the next post.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot;  &gt;Walking back to my car, there was a random tractor. But that's oklahoma.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/threeposts/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 27 Mar 2009 06:36:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/27/start-with-ladies-night/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/27/start-with-ladies-night/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>twitter thoughts too long for twitter</title>
          <description>A conversation today on twitter got me to thinking about photography, and culture and style and art and society. There was a photographer, who shall remain nameless to protect the innocent, who's work really demonstrates all that's wrong with the world right now. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The photographer that brought up all these questions is a very successful commercial photographer. Very polished, styled images. There are a lot of things that I don't like about them. A lot of his images are super low contrast, with no blacks (tonality, not people) at all, while also cropping off body parts willy-nilly. His lighting also bothers me- the photos strike me as the kind you need an army of assistants (well, at least two or three) to maintain-complex and unnatural. Not every shot should be into the light, all of them can't be at golden hour, and sweat is never that perfectly placed. It's a distinctive look, but it's a plastic look, it's one I've seen a thousand times before. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We live in a dissafected, disenfranchised society. There are the indebted, and there are the people we owe money to. The rich are few and far between, something like 5% of the population at any given time, depending on your definition of rich. Money as we think of it now has no basis in the real world, but is merely some numbers in digital domains. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Given that, where is art? It's all gold and glam and crazy hair and tight pants. It's abstract and disconnected and complex. It's thin, insubstantial. It's going to fall apart. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It's the lack of substance that I keep coming back to in my thinking; those photographs, even of somewhat interesting subjects, were plastic and boring, stamped out of a mill of complicated lights and staged action-peaks that only look like decisive moments. They are the shiny object, to be consumed and tossed away without thought. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Where are the real photographs, the photographers of the world as it is? I'm not talking about people wandering to far flung regions to uncover the the worst of the worst, I'm talking about the local people, the ones doing projects and reporting on local things? Where are these photographers? They're out there, I'm sure it's not just me laboring under a delusion. I know because I'm one of 'em.</description>
          <pubDate>Wed, 25 Mar 2009 19:58:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/25/twitter-thoughts-too-long-for-twitter/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/25/twitter-thoughts-too-long-for-twitter/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>This one goes out to Mom</title>
          <description>Yeah, sure, sappy, I know. Go fuck yourself. My mom is in the hospital for the 13th time since September. Or was it August? I can't remember when she started dialysis, but it was around then. 3 A.V. fistulas, a peritoneal port, 6 cardiac caths, a couple infections, surgeries to install and remove the above, time for monitoring, recovering, etc, etc. She's been through a lot. And she's still not done, although it now seems that they've got a handle on why the fistulas keep failing so consistently, it's a 2% of the population kind of problem. Now she's going to rest for a couple months and they're going to do something different for a dialysis access. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;She might murder me for posting this, but oh well, at least then I won't have to worry about my student loans. This was right before they took her back for surgery today.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/mom/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 24 Mar 2009 03:44:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/24/this-one-goes-out-to-mom/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/24/this-one-goes-out-to-mom/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Home, where the laptop is</title>
          <description>&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Phil the wonderdog, and his owner Todd.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, it was a fairly disastrous weekend, with a few redeeming moments that made the trip to Austin just shy of a total waste. So I blogged about Thursday evening, and then took my laptop into the kitchen for some browsing and conversation. I plugged in the laptop so it could charge, and then when I got up I tripped over the cord and knocked it onto the floor, breaking the screen. So, sans laptop, I didn't blog or process pictures the rest of the weekend. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Steves was there, somewhat improbably.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That afternoon, there was an alley cat and a movie premiere. I got DFL in the alley cat, and saw half the movie, which looked pretty good, and then decided to strike out towards the action. There were free drinks somewhere, I could smell them. Come to think of it, that might have been the empty beer in my hand. Oh well. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The bikes piled up before the alleycat. Yay dfl!&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That night, my luck was a little better. We got in to a party with free tequila, but then, standing in a long line waiting for drinks, Sarah decdided to go see Devo, who I don't care about, and so we all left the party with the free booze and I went and walked sixth street for a couple hours while they were at the show. That's where I saw the coolest thing of the whole trip. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;There was a guy standing between two van de graaff (lightning) generators, all covered in chainmail. The lightning striking him was modulated so that the lightning was a speaker. The lightning noise was the music.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;F'ing amazing.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;From there, I wandered until my feet hurt, then sat a little, then wandered a little, in a &quot;diminishing returns&quot; situation until I was walking a block and sitting on a curb for five minutes, and then getting up and moving along. Somewhere in there was pizza and a coke. Then Devo was over, and everyone went back to the party with the free drinks, where, after I'd had one beer and one shot of tequila, they ran out of booze.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Back at the house to sleep, only to wake up in the morning to no computer and no internets. Saturday was half-decent DJ's during the day followed by a rather nice evening hanging with Todd (my host, remember) and his girlfriend Kelli. Fairly interesting people, the both of them. Todd really really needs to show his paintings in a gallery. I know people, professional art people (gallery people), who would kill for paintings like his.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Oh yeah, &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.furburger.org&quot;&gt;cmay&lt;/a&gt; was there too.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Sunday morning, we woke up and drove back. Contained in that sentence was another highlight of the trip- driving north on I-35, big puffy clouds overhead, radiohead on the stereo, and finally, for a little while, everything was right with the world. Now I'm home. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;People at the &quot;Mess with Texas&quot; show right next to the capitol. This was a nice moment when I was sitting on a rock.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sxswlast/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 23 Mar 2009 13:51:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/23/home-where-the-laptop-is/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/23/home-where-the-laptop-is/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>SXSW update....</title>
          <description>So we're still here, still haven't seen any shows, and if it weren't for our gracious and intelligent host, we wouldn't even have had and free beer. Austin is really going to have to kick it up a notch to save itself from this one. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;Beginning of the night, all dressed up, still hopeful.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/night2sxsw/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We went to the party 45 minutes early and there was already a line a couple hundred people long. For some reason, when you tell people free beer and hot DJ's, they line up like it's the cure for stupidity. And then stand there. For two hours. While people cut, and get to go in vip. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;On the way, the night looked promising.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/night2sxsw/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Seems to me it's an intelligence test. It sounds like a good idea to go stand in line for a little while and get a bunch of free shit- booze, music, hot, scantily clad women etc. There's a limit to how much you can stand there though, and here's where the intelligence test comes in: the smarter you are, the sooner you leave. When we left, there were still 200 people standing in line, not about to get in. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The line, when we got there. Seemed like we'd get in.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/night2sxsw/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Now, they were at capacity when they stopped letting people in, I'm sure. But after a bunch of people leave, why not let the people at the front of the line in? Instead, they were only allowing VIP's, which unfortunately, we're not. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;The same line, 45 minutes later.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/night2sxsw/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, we gave up after about an hour of just standing there. In our defense, there were maybe 20 people in front of us; it seemed possible, when they said they were at capacity, that we might get in after some people left. Then we came back to the house, (Todd's house) and drank beer and talked late into the night with todd, todd's friend who works for SNL, and his girlfriend, who's name I've forgotten. Longtime blogreaders and friends will know this is because I'm horrible with names.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;caption&quot; &gt;This was as far as we got. Then we gave up and commenced drinking.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/night2sxsw/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 20 Mar 2009 17:04:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/20/sxsw-update/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/20/sxsw-update/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>day 1 sxsw</title>
          <description>Today has kinda been a blur... there was morning coffee, burritos, american appearal factory seconds sale, walking around, biking around, whole foods, lots of music, lost of fun. And I haven't even had any free beer yet.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/day1sxsw/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 20 Mar 2009 02:48:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/20/day-1-sxsw/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/20/day-1-sxsw/</link>

        <item>
          <title>In austin. on a couch.</title>
          <description>&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, throwing yourself at the mercy of the universe occasionally does work out. I'm on a couch here in Austin, TX, mere miles from downtown and the famous and ever popular SXSW music fest. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The whole journey started this morning, when Sarah twittered about going to SXSW today, to catch some band. So I called her and asked if she could delay an extra half hour, to give me time to get my shit together ( I thought we were leaving tomorrow). She told me she didn't really have shit together either, and so I had time, meet at her house, and everything would be cool. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It took for-ev-er to get out of OKC though- one thing after another kept going wrong, or errands that should have taken just a few minutes took an hour, and on and on. It was like the karmic forces of the city didn't want to let us go. Finally, after something like 2 hours of running around, we were ready to go. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The drive down was good- there was a nice sunset, some McD's, a little nap, and not a few pictures. I drove the last 40 minutes, and after a couple tries, parallel parked the car on an off street east of downtown. We got on our bikes, and not two minutes later were yelled at by some cops. Nice job austin PD, making people new in town feel welcome. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, jetting away from that situation (nice thing about bikes in a city- there's little chance for someone in a car to catch you), we found ourselves right in the middle of the maddness, on the mainline, we hit the central nerve, etc, etc. Only to be greeted by a sign outside all the official venues: no photography without a press pass. Bullshit I say. The good news is that for the most part we're going to be frequenting unofficial parties and venues; apparently that's where the best parts are. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Went from there to the long branch, which was a cool little joint. Nice atmos, good music, interesting clientele (if you could call them that). I had a couple beers, and that (and a short ride back to the car, and a short car ride) brings me to the present tense. Oh yeah, and there's a crazy jumpy dog in the house we're staying at. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/toaustin/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Thu, 19 Mar 2009 08:02:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/19/in-austin-on-a-couch/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/19/in-austin-on-a-couch/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Japanther rocks your face off</title>
          <description>Show was good. bunch of good pics. invented the unintentional photo essay. Don't worry, I'll explain later. Gotta go get my shit together for SXSW. See you all on the flip side.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/japanther/0010.jpg&quot;         <item>
          <title>Openbeta2</title>
          <description>Last night was openbeta, and it was actually a really cool interesting event. I'm not just saying that, you know; a lot of talks and conferences bore the shit out of me, and I just leave in the middle of them. OK, so I stepped out for a smoke in the middle of one of the boring lightning talks, but other than that, it was good.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;This is Grant, giving his demo of Twircl, which still hasn't launched, but is by far the coolest thing I've seen one of my friends come up with since art school. Twircl is a direct group messaging app that runs on top of twitter, something that the system  needs.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;These are the wimgo girls, and, well, do I really need to say anything. Thanks for the pen, ladies.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Grant kills 'em with his presentation:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Voltron Presents: Why they're awesome. I need to find out if they have any staff photographer openings. Maybe they need a screwball wandering correspondent for their web side? Y/Y?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The view from OKCCoCo:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Afterparty:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;There was a good reason for these faces, but I can't remember for the life of me why.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/openbeta2/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Pictures until I was too drunk to focus</title>
          <description>By which I actually mean there are more photos, and some of them are in focus, but after the last one here (which we'll pretend was intentional), I was walking the fine line between blackout and just stupid, and so none of those photos are any good. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'm actually not sure any of these are any good, but they're kind of fun, at least. That's the threshold these days for blog-worthy photos, if I think someone I know will get a laugh or like it or link or somesuch, then I'll put it up. Actually, there's a quality threshold as well, see paragraph 1 for example. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Wednesday was a pretty epic night, and actually it's a good thing, because my money's just about run out again. Time to find another jobby job. I did a pretty good job of embarrassing myself in front of girls I barely know, and some old friends in the mix too. It's strange, the way things run in circles sometimes. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I've never seen a look on Cyrus's face like the one below, but it's probably always there under the surface- a sort of laughing incredulity. Either that or it's drunkface and I'm reading too much into a picture.  &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Reagan always makes the best photo-faces. It's like she's screaming &quot;I&quot;M REAGAN&quot; with her whole face. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And here's the old friends I was talking about- Chase and Brian- I've known Brian since high school. He'll probably get pissed and send me more death threats, but that's a risk I'm willing to take to bring everyone quality photos. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I really like this pic, for some ineffable reason. I know, I know. Shoot me. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/drunkface/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 13 Mar 2009 22:39:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/13/pictures-until-i-was-too-drunk-to-focus/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/13/pictures-until-i-was-too-drunk-to-focus/</link>

        <item>
          <title>Film is too much</title>
          <description>Shooting in a bit of a different mode yesterday. With the digital camera. Decided film was too expensive. So sue me. I don't think the look suffers that much. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I like how even the McD's sign is screwed up. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Every time I talk about this project, people bring up the tower theatre; looking at the fron of it, I wonder if it wouldn't be easier to just build a new one in the vacant lot across the street. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/23rdday3/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The shooting yesterday wasn't as good, as fulfilling as is was the first couple outings; I thought, walking back, that I might just give up the project and move on. But it seems like I'm onto something; the dilapidation there is a symptom of the wider economic problems. I can't tell if it's getting worse or better. Also, I look at the pictures, see I'm doing good work, and can hardly stop myself.</description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 09 Mar 2009 17:03:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/09/film-is-too-much/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/09/film-is-too-much/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Momentum Artshow</title>
          <description>Momentum 09 was last night, and I was really surprised by the quality and scope and size and attendance of the show. It was packed, the work was 75% good, all stuff I'm not used to seeing in this town, and it filled a freaking warehouse. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;There were a lot of big open installations, a lof of big cool paintings, some shit photos (sorry everyone, but the photo showing this year just wasn't that great, with a few notable exceptions). Hving these clouds right by the entrance set the mood for the place: it was as if someone took a piece of a real art scene out of the air of New York or Santa Fe and stuck it here in oak city, improbably and strangely. So it seemed natural to see a crib full of beer bongs and a whole room of homoerotic black fraternity induction paintings. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then there was my friend Bobby's band, playing a pretty rad live set. If they'd had a cd available, I'd have bought one, and that's not something I do a lot. These kids know how to rock. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0011.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0012.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0013.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then there was this womblike installation in what used to be a woman's restroom. It was completely transformed and amazing; all it needed was some giant pillows on the floor and some mild hallucinogenic gas in the air and it would have been perfect.    &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0014.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I didn't know what to think of the deer. But I like the photo, so sue me. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0015.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Some MC, not all that great. Nobody's perfect, maybe he was havin' an off night. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0016.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then there was the after after after party, which was really about four people in Jim's apartment eating cheese and drinking french wine. I'd like to say it was a nice end to the night, but there were a couple fights on the lawn that complicated things. So instead it was kind of a haggard exhausted end to the evening, but at least it was in good company.  &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0017.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Sun, 08 Mar 2009 20:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/08/momentum-artshow/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/08/momentum-artshow/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>

Francois, on wednesday: &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Ray-guns, at McNellie's:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Cody at blue note:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It was one of those nights where I was the drunk one. Not as drunk as some people, though, and that turned out to be a good thing. I told Sarah early on in the night that I'd make sure she got home alright. She did, and I crashed on her couch.  My good deed for the week done, I give you the morning after:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/momentum/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;More in a few minutes, when I get the real momentum post together.</description>
          <pubDate>Sun, 08 Mar 2009 19:41:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/08/some-random-photos/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/08/some-random-photos/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Candid Portraits for Hire</title>
          <description>&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/grantsfambp/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, this is a New Idea. At least, I think it's new, and if it isn't, well, I don't know anybody that does it. The idea is, a lot of people like to have good pictures of their family; in fact, this is the only thing a lot of people care to have pictures of. But studio pictures from places like walmart or sears or even glamour shots suck.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/grantsfambp/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So instead of a studio, what about the home? And instead of a quick grin-and-grab, what about spending some time with the family, say two hours- over dinner, maybe, or an afternoon in the park? Candid pictures the whole time, and give the family digital copies that they can do whatever they want with? If they want to order prints through me, that's fine, but I'd rather make money shooting than printing, so that's where the charges come from.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/grantsfambp/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The pictures here in this post were shot in the space of about an hour and a half; These aren't all of the keepers, just enough for a teaser. I ended up sending the family 25 images in all, all of which I was happy with.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/grantsfambp/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, if anyone is interested in this being done with their family, just drop me a line at my email, rates are negotiable, and depend on how much and what you want me to do.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/grantsfambp/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 03 Mar 2009 05:23:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/03/candid-portraits-for-hire/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/03/03/candid-portraits-for-hire/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Just photos</title>

        <item>
          <title>Perspectives? More like Photos</title>
          <description>Last night was portrait night, or a really wild ass night, or a depressing fucker, or a wild debauch, all depending on your perspective. Crying girls, a night in the drunk tank, someone got neck punched, someone else got shot down, couple people got laid (I assume), someone went 59mph on rollers, it goes on and on. Me, I took it mellow, took some pictures, and passed out on a couch. I'm feeling lazy, so here's photos. If you want more details, call someone who knows. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0001.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0002.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0003.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0005.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0006.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0007.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0008.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0009.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0010.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/shotdown/0011.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;</description>

        <item>
          <title>Crane go Boom</title>
          <description>Crane accident at the Dean Mcgee Eye institute's new construction. No injuries reported at this time, however the operator did have to call home for a spare pair of pants to be brought to the site. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3355/3306731606_bfd2c0d70d_o.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;Photos&quot;/&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Seriously, it's a good thing that nobody got hurt, and I can't help but think it's probably a indicator of good procedure somewhere that nobody was stupid enough to be underneath the running crane. As for the causes, could be operator error, could be equipment malfunction, I don't know. Five minutes from now it'll be old news.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Update: My dad (a pipe weldor with ~40 years on construction sites) tells me that it was almost definitely operator error. The main line was pulled too tight, the cable snapped, everything jumps and goes slack, at which point the lack of tension causes the jib to fall. It was a huge stroke of luck, according to dad, that the crane came down in an empty area, and also that the operator is alive.</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 24 Feb 2009 14:33:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/02/24/crane-go-boom/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/02/24/crane-go-boom/</link>

        <item>
          <title>your camera does matter</title>
          <description>OK, so I'm tired of all this bullshit on the web about how &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.kenrockwell.com/tech/notcamera.htm&quot;&gt;your camera doesn't matter&lt;/a&gt;, no need for that 4000 dollar setup, etc. Then there was &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.amazon.com/gp/blog/post/PLNK2603NP5A00POX&quot;&gt;this crap&lt;/a&gt; (which I got via &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.kottke.org/09/02/a-poor-photographer-blames-his-tools&quot;&gt;kottke&lt;/a&gt;, a pretty good blog usually) about how the old masters, those before autofocus and autoexposure had it about the same as anyone with a point and shoot. The photographers he mentions for the most part shot with Leicas, cameras renowned for their speed, quality, and ability to work in low light even with the ISO 400 films of the time. (The author of that piece confuses old color emulsions, which were very slow, with black and white, which have been reasonable since the mid nineteen thirties). Henri Cartier-Bresson, one of my personal heroes, whom he mentions by name, was famous for almost always using a 50mm f/2 lens and ISO 400 Tri-x, moderately fast film with incredible tonalities possible. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'm not saying it's impossible to make good photos with cheap or lesser cameras. I'm even using some of the shots from my old G9 in the book I'm trying to produce. But telling people to buck up and try harder in the face of the crap that is the consumer camera market right now, well, that's bullshit. The factors that are comparable are not the important ones to photographers. The important things are all related to creative control and perspective. The reason little digital cameras mostly suck is you have little control over how the thing sees; it's very hard to fit your vision into a little screen. Here's a list of the things that do matter, though:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;1. Format size. This comes before every other consideration, as it is a defining characteristic of how the camera will work, its weight, how the image is printed, how depth of field is established, all sorts of things. Bigger gives higher technical image quality, and smaller means better ease of use. My personal choice is the 24x36mm rectangle- a good balance between optical and tonal qualities and the ability to move around. Notice I say here &quot;format&quot; and not &quot;megapixels&quot;; the difference being that format is very important and megapixels aren't anymore. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;2. Shutter Lag. THIS WAS ALMOST NUMBER ONE. That's because it's so often overlooked and it's perhaps the most important to the most photographers (potential and actual). A camera's shutter lag needs to be small, less than one tenth of a second, for it to be remotely useful in getting a moment, which for me is all of photography. Most crappy (P&amp;S) cameras, you could press the shutter button, go have lunch, come back, start a pot of coffee for the afternoon, and then, finally, the camera will make the exposure. Completely unacceptable. In most old manual cameras, this wasn't a problem, because the mechanical path from the shutter to the button was short and fast. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;3. Focal Length. You may say that for a given photographer, they will have many lenses, but many tend toward one end of the spectrum or another- James Nachtwey uses wide angles a lot, Cartier-Bresson preferred the fifty (normal in his preferred 35mm format), paparazzi live and die by their telephoto lenses, and if you ask ten photographers, you'll get ten answers, all unique. I'm a normal and wider kind of photographer, 50 and 20. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;4. Minimum F/stop- This determines the most amount of light that the lens can allow to pass through. I cart around a huge honking 50mm f/1.2, which gathers light somewhat akin to a radio telescope collecting signal, but that's because I work in dark rooms with sketchy nonexistent lighting a lot. For most people, f/2 is plenty for most situations.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;OK, so for most point and shoots, the lenses suck, the format sucks, the viewing sucks, and the shutter lag is longer than a smoke break. It's a miracle these things make pictures at all. You almost have to be a savant to get anything good out of them. To the people out there that know better, please stop bullshitting amateurs into thinking that their camreras are capable machines, because more than likely the machine sucks and they haven't a hope of getting better with it. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;PS- Ken Rockwell, while being a little odd a lot of the time, has a lot of good smart things to say about photography and cameras, so long as you know he's joking half of the time. The other guy makes some good points, too, but really, if the camera didn't matter, we'd all be painters. Now go take some pictures.</description>
          <pubDate>Tue, 24 Feb 2009 04:13:00 GMT</pubDate>
          <guid>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/02/24/your-camera-does-matter/</guid>
          <link>http://notuntitled.com/articles/2009/02/24/your-camera-does-matter/</link>
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Sunday Sunday Sunday</title>
          <description>Today was a good day in paradise. Started out sleeping in a bit, then went to brunch/coffee/movie with Lori:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The brunch we were going to go to (the guatemalan on classen) is closed sundays, or at least it was closed today, so we went to cafe do brasil, where I got my chorizo fix over eggs and a side of Mimosa. Coffee at coffeeslingers, mostly to kill time, and then onto the movie, Taken, which was awesome- the most realistic fight scenes I can recall in a movie. Brutal, fast paced, and it could've ended about five minutes before it did. No need to sugar coat the ending, Hollywood. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Then, with Lori off to study something boring, I was free to go shoot golden hour on 23rd street. I had to go around twice to get the photo of the capitol. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;These same people are always hanging out on that bench in the corner. I don't know if they live in the apartments out of frame to the left or they're homeless and that's just their spot. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Homage to Eugene Atget. Wig shop. It was always a little but of a surprise to hit the end of a roll so quickly; about half an hour walking and 141 pictures. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0005.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0006.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0007.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0008.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0009.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/sundayx3/0010.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So, I walked from Robinson to Classen, dropped off the four rolls I'd shot at Walgreens, and went to grab a bite while they were being run. I have my doubts about the usability of these photo cd scans; fine for web, but I'm going to need to scan them better to make prints. Might just not bother next time and scan everything at home. Then again it does make blogging a lot easier.</description>

        <item>
          <title>Lacking the will to blog</title>
          <description>Right now, I should tell the story of the excellent day I had shooting with &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.jeremycharles.com/blog/&quot;&gt;Jeremy Charles&lt;/a&gt;, or rather him shooting and me assisting, but I think I can may be just say that it was a good time, picked up a few new tricks for my lighting bag, and it was nice to be able to talk to someone about photography who's been where I'm at and receive a little encouragement. Also, I had a moment to grab a few photos of the first band, who's name I forget. This is why I usually take notes of these things. Anyway, Photos (now with black borders!):&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/assisting/0001.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/assisting/0002.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/assisting/0003.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://www.photographermattmills.com/images/assisting/0004.jpg&quot;  alt=&quot;Photos&quot; /&gt;</description>
